Job_title: Business Intelligence Analyst & Developer-BAY OF PLENTY
Summary:
ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our client is an industry leader in their field and a prominent Te Puke employer.People across this business are passionate about what they do and know their industry inside and out, as such, they have high expectations of technology and the support team. The environment is fun and collaborative, a sense of humour will go a long way here.

ABOUT THE ROLE

My client has two exciting roles for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst who would be required to have an advanced level of SQL application development and Data warehouse management experience to be able to manage and consolidate disparate data sources as well as providing high level of business analytics capability. The role is responsible for ensuring that the development are delivered to industry best practice standards in a consistent, accurate and timely manner.

DUTIES
Understand existing data feeds from production applications and develop routines to import/merge them as required
Responsible all administration, security and maintenance of data warehouse and related artefacts
Ensuring all databases queries are optimised for performance and storage
Working with system engineers to ensure ongoing performance and availability of all relevant database applications.
Develop visualisation via PowerBI and other related technologies
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Experience in sourcing data from many different environments and working with large and complex data sets
Experience using API's or similar interfaces for sourcing data
Prioritisation and time management skills
Experience with Microsoft Power BI, Power Query/Pivot for Excel and preferably reporting services
Great communication skills both verbal and written


HOW TO APPLY
Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Neha on 07 834 0412

NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions.
Others may not necessarily be responded to.

At the TAB we believe in constant growth, transformation and improvement - we are a truly diverse business and being a totally Kiwi operation, what we do touches the lives of a great number of people, the length and breadth of the country.
As we grow and transform, we are excited to begin the search for an exciting new opportunity in our Betting & Product team - Head of Product.

The Head of Product is ultimately responsible for leading the development and implementation of both current product enhancements and features and also the next generation of features and products we offer to customers.
Leading a team of Product Managers and Analysts, areas of product focus and delivery include Sport, Racing, Accounts, Retail and Platform. As a member of the Betting and Product Leadership Team, and in a key role in the wider leadership of the business this role will take accountability for growth objectives and provide aligned.

Who we are looking for:
We are seeking someone with strong Digital Product background and experience in a leadership role. Being passionate and innovative goes without saying, and the idea of strong growth and big delivery targets should excite not scare you!

7+ years' experience in a Product Management or Owner role
Knowledge & experience of end-to-end product development
Demonstrated ability to use customer research, data & analytics to build & enhance the product roadmap
Strong statistical & numerical skills
Interest or passion for the sports & wagering industries
Proven ability to have honest conversations - and drive performance in your immediate team and the broader function

The Head of Product role will lead the entire team to ensure deep understanding of the needs of customers, and facilitate the development of products to meet these needs. Working directly with the team and coaching to effectively communicate with key stakeholders, you will ensure clear scope, objectives and revenue for assigned products or assigned functional areas is established.

Key requirements of this role:
Management of the Product Roadmap, and ensure clear communication of key dates and scope to the business
Ensure comprehensive market requirements are specified for current and future products by conducting market research
Ensure the team effectively work with key stakeholders, determine and communicate product risks both prior to commencement and as they arise throughout a product's life
Drive effective research and develop innovative ideas that will assist the TAB to meet its key objectives within the product space

The role of Head of Product will see you ensuring your team works collaboratively with the Development and UX teams to design, build and release software products for the business to a high standard - this is an excellent opportunity to take the lead and manage the entire product life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities, developing and implementing a company-wide go-to-market plan, working with all departments to execute this efficiently.

As a key part of the Betting and Product Leadership Team, you will build effective relationships throughout the business & with external partners:
Be a key point of contact for stakeholders and oversee the progression of products through development, testing and rollout, including regular reporting on progress
Facilitate product reviews and document findings of those reviews to ensure continual improvement in project delivery
Measure product performance against success metrics and seek solutions to drive performance where required, reporting as needed
Lead the Product team in facilitating a prioritised backlog, ensuring the ordering of the items in the Product Backlog best achieve goals and missions
Lead the engagement and relationship management with vendors, focussing on improving the delivery of outcomes to customers

This role is an opportunity for an established and experienced Head of Product to successfully lead the Product Management Team in developing and implementing current product enhancements. Additionally establishing new and innovative products across all the areas of product focus that will meet customer needs and wants.

A bit more about us:
Operating just over 550 TAB retail outlets, as well as our own national television and radio channels, we're an integral part of cities, towns and communities nationwide. We're on a mission to enhance Kiwis' involvement and enjoyment of racing and sport, by providing a thrilling betting, racing and sports experience, and delivering increased returns back to the racing industry. The TAB is operated by the Racing Industry Transition Agency (RITA).

Applications and referrals are open now - either apply online, or contact Alex on 027 252 5770 for a confidential discussion.

Collections Analyst - Design & Engagement Team

Collections Analyst
Permanent full-time role
Design Team (Field Collections)
Auckland
We have an exciting opportunity available in our Design Team within the Field Collections Unit of Collection Operations. If you have experience working on process improvement initiatives, provide insights into data collection best practice, skilled in research and analysis and have excellent communication skills then this role could be for you!
The purpose of the role
We are looking for a person who can work on collection projects to improve collection performance and respondent experience as well as undertake complex analysis and research.
Each team in Collection Analysis and Support has a range of skills, strengths and knowledge, and is led by a Senior Collections Analyst. Some of the responsibilities include leading the development and implementation of innovative initiatives, advanced collections analysis and modelling, and providing support to management and operational areas.
Who we are
Stats NZ Tatauranga Aotearoa is New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency. Our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. We lead the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment and we are looking for an experienced analyst who can lead research initiatives and teams.
The Collection Operations branch is at the forefront of sustainable data sourcing from businesses and households across NZ. This integrated Design team are experts in the “on-the-ground” practical world of data collections. Much of the Team’s work will inform the future Survey Collection Approaches that they will design / create. The Design Team will consult within Collection Operations and engage with our Stakeholders and the wider-organisation when they are creating these future Collection Approaches, processes and systems. We are looking for a person who can work on collection projects to improve collection performance and provide complex analysis and research to enable decision making
As a Collections Analyst, you will:
Contribute to initiatives that add value and advance data discovery, sourcing and sustainable collection
Provide advanced analysis and research into paradata
Assess and report on the impact of proposed changes on our business of data collection (e.g. methods, costs, processes, work volumes)
Liaise and build relationships across the Collection Operations management and operational teams.
Support the Design team and wider Collections Leadership with key papers
Person specifications
To be successful in this role you’ll need to be enthusiastic, driven, and able to hit the ground running. If you have the following, we want to hear from you:
Technical, research and analytical skills (e.g. Excel, SAS, SQL or R programming, analysis and data modelling, business process improvement)
Knowledge of data collection and able to offer insight for its advancement
Fantastic interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to interact across all levels within the organisation
A relevant tertiary qualification, preferably with a degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, accountancy, business, data or computer science
A minimum of 5 years’ relevant experience is desirable.
What’s in it for you?
We care about our people, and value your drive, energy and inquisitive nature.
If you are a passionate and talented person seeking to add value every day and relishes the idea of becoming part of NZ’s data system, then come join our team!
For more information about this role please contact Lorna Curran (lorna.curran@stats.govt.nz)
Applications close on 22 February 2020, 17:00pm.
For more about working for us see http://careers.stats.govt.nz/

----------------
About HelloFresh
----------------

At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 7 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market.

So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 13 different countries across 3 continents.

If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.

---------------
Job description
---------------

This role is a fantastic opportunity for a recent graduate or someone part way through their studies with a procurement and an analytical background. You would be part of a true start up and part of the journey in growing HelloFresh in NZ. We are looking for someone who can commit Full-Time for a duration of 6 months.

You will…

Working within the Procurement team to act as a point of contact across other operational teams, including the production, logistics and business development teams
Scoping, analysing and implementing the project, along with the project lead, to ensure operations and costs are controlled and the project aims are met on time
Sourcing, negotiation and onboarding of new suppliers and SKUs with collaboration with the respective Category Managers
Get a view on current procurement relevant data available in the company
Conduct data analysis on available procurement data & and existing dashboards to build comprehensive view on proc team performance and areas of improvements
Build dashboards based on gaps identified
Support in generating category insights for category managers
Support during the budgeting
Potentially helping out during the tendering process
----------------------
Mandatory requirements
----------------------

You have…

You have a Degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Business Management or similar from a top-tier university
You have experience working in a Supply Chain, Procurement or Project Management role, ideally in food
You have extensive hands-on experience working with Excel and Google Sheets at an advanced level (Pivot tables, Index-matches, advanced formulas)
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals
You are proactive, autonomous with an entrepreneur mindset
Ability to work on tasks autonomously that have a high level of responsibility, and communicate progress effectively to key stakeholders
You are ...

Obsessed with food!
Autonomous, able to manage a project from start to finish with little guidance
Proactive
Passionate about our business
What we offer...
Heavily discounted HelloFresh boxes
You work in a passionate and dynamic environment
Flat hierarchies, constant learning with plenty of room for personal growth
Duration: 6 Months PAID Internship. You must be able to commit FULL - TIME (Monday to Friday 9 am - 6 pm). You MUST have the right to work in NZ for the duration of the contract.

Start date: June 2020

Programmed Professionals are one of Australasia's largest and longest serving technical and professional recruitment providers. We are currently recruiting for one of our prestigious clients within New Zealand.
Please click to apply or contact Natalie at Programmed Professionals on 03 341 4140 for a confidential discussion.
About the role;
The Planning Manager is responsible for the data management and the asset planning integrity on this major portfolio of properties. In this role you will be searching and locating the assets to streamline which require long term plans. This role is predominately office based and most of your time will be spent planning, forecasting and setting the budgets for the following year. In this position your main responsibilities will be, but not limited to:
Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans
Maintaining the ongoing maintenance and upgrades of a single asset management system
Be the escalation point for the outsourced Facilities Managers
The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme
Reviewing quotes and raising purchase orders within your works limit
Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety
The ideal candidate would have the following attributes;
Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment
Sound experience in asset planning, forecasting and budgeting
Key understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental fundamentals
Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen
What's on offer?
A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. The client is close to public transport and is centrally located in the city fringe area. They offer a flexible work environment and have a magnificent building, you will also be working in a collaborative workspace.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Contract opportunity for a Technical Business Analyst to work on a SharePoint upgrade project. Your role will be to complete analysis to determine the current critical business processes/functions that exist in the old SharePoint 2010 environment, understand the path forward for each, and the impact (business, technical and data) that this path will have.
The expected outcomes of this engagement are:
Identification of dependant business functionality contained within the current SharePoint 2010 environment, primarily focused on key high usage business areas
In conjunction with Solution Architecture establish of a set of principles to support the identified areas in a non-SharePoint world
Development of a plan for each identified area to move, based on the principles identified in the above
The successful candidate will:
Be able to straddle business and technology seamlessly
Be able to work autonomously, and seek clarity within an ambiguous and complex environment
At a minimum will have a basic understanding of SharePoint
Be comfortable working with an iterative approach to outcome
Be able to work across locations – Wellington CBD and Lower Hutt – as required



HOW TO APPLY
Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Hayley MacDonald or Justin Kissling on 0800 29 89 99.

NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions.
Others may not necessarily be responded to.

The Principal Analyst role within Climate Change Operations is the key source of expertise on forest carbon accounting and reporting in the NZETS. If successful, you will have the unique opportunity to take technical and regulatory responsibility for world-leading, national-scale forest carbon assessment. You will have particular responsibility for operational application and enhancement of the Field Measurement Approach (FMA), the national-scale measurement-based approach to forest carbon assessment under the NZETS. You will contribute to the leadership of the climate change operations environment and lead delivery of all aspects of carbon accounting and reporting for forestry participants under the NZETS, on behalf of the New Zealand Government. You will be the primary source of operational expertise on the legislation and regulations governing forest carbon reporting and accounting under the NZETS, and for resolution of complex cases (including compliance).
About the company
This company has a strength of common purpose and a passion to sustainably grow and to protect Aotearoa, for the benefit of all New Zealanders. They are a team of experts with massive breadth of experience, offering opportunities to break out of our comfort zone and embrace intellectual and complex challenges. They’re working towards sustainability, protection, growth and participation.
Forestry is one of our country’s most successful primary industries. Te Uru Rākau, a branch within this company, builds on this success to create a sustainable and innovative forestry sector that continues to grow and adapt.
About the role
You will work across Te Uru Rākau to provide expert advice, intellectual leadership and develop the capability of in-house team members. You will collaborate externally with stakeholders in Government and the private sector to share subject matter expertise and establish yourself as a trusted adviser with the forestry sector. Through these relationships, you will explore opportunities to improve services to customers, and influence innovation and the direction of priorities in the forestry sector.
Your initial focus will be on ensuring continuity for on-going technical operation and enhancement of the FMA, including business process and software development to support existing and new functionality. You will also be involved in the application of the FMA under new carbon accounting approaches and forest land categories to be introduced under the NZETS from 2020 onwards.
Key responsibilities:
Intellectual and technical lead on operational matters relating to forestry in the NZETS, including implementation to service new Legislation and Regulations on forest carbon accounting/reporting.
Provide in-depth technical knowledge of forest inventory, forest growth modelling, carbon allocation, and the operation of the FMA for the production of carbon yield tables for NZETS participants.
Oversight of all technical and data processing aspects of day-to-day FMA operations, and act as the lead expert for wider forest carbon accounting/reporting under the NZETS.
Provide technical input to improving business process and software development related to carbon accounting and reporting
Become the key source of expertise on operational application of the relevant NZETS legislation, regulations, standards and guidance.
Establish acceptance by NZETS participants as a trusted and knowledgeable technical adviser, and develop a wide knowledge of the forestry sector and the role of carbon in forestry economic viability.
Benefits:
Refurbished offices close to Railway Station
Up to three additional (company holidays) leave days
Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation
Comprehensive one-week Induction Programme
Bi-annual paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames

Do you want to use cutting edge technology to prevent crime and make a real difference?

Financial Crime is a dynamic and complex world and this role provides a challenging opportunity to harness data and analytics to detect and prevent Financial Crime, including Fraud.

About the role:

There is never a dull day in this dynamic and fast paced environment. The Financial Crime team has some of the most up to date and actionable data in the bank. You will be part of a collaborative, innovative and supportive team who work closely together to detect and prevent fraud.

In this critical role, you will be challenged with utilising analytics in identifying, quantifying and managing financial crime risk. You will be using data analytics to provide intelligence to manage both immediate risks as well as provide advice on the financial crime landscape and future risks. As a Financial Crime analyst, you’ll be a numerically minded individual who is comfortable discussing your work, explaining your findings and recommending responses within a fast paced and constantly evolving environment.

Normal hours of work may include weekends and being on call which will be arranged on a rotational basis within the Analytics team.

What you’ll need to succeed:

2+ years’ experience working in an analytics role, ideally in a financial services environment
Understanding of the key financial crime drivers and the dynamics of fraud
Strong skills in SQL, R, SAS
Demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret data
Comfortable using visualisation tools like Power BI
Be a team player
Ability to operate effectively in a fast paced and demanding environment.
What’s great about working for Westpac?

We’re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we’ll invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your ongoing learning and development.


As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme and fantastic staff banking package.


Sound like you? Let’s go!

Apply today with your CV and cover letter by following the link on this page. For more information contact tanuja.amat@westpac.co.nz

South Auckland Location
At the Manukau Institute of Technology (MIT) our purpose is to get people into great jobs. We have been changing lives in South Auckland since 1970, and are one of the largest providers of technical, vocational and professional education in New Zealand. We offer a variety of courses from certificates to degrees across our 3 Campuses. Every year 16,000 students choose to study at MIT, and over 1500 staff choose to make it their place of work.
The People and Culture team are looking to recruit an experienced People Experience HRIS Analyst. Reporting to the EGM People and Culture, this position will form part of the People Experience Team and be responsible for ensuring that the new HRIS system at MIT - MyMIT continues to meet the needs of the Institute, including overseeing all the data management, processes, organisational structure, reporting, payroll maintenance and procedures for the system.
Varied in your day to day role, one day you may be managing the fortnightly people and culture maintenance, another managing our remuneration review process and the next running diversity reports or managing organisational structures. The role supports both the organisation and the People and Culture team in data management. This role is critical to the overseeing the integrity of the system and will firstly be responsible for setting our data management principles and then looking after the integrity of that data and processes.
Whilst this is a sole charge role, being part of the people and culture team means you have the support of the other members of the team. The role also has extensive day to day liaison with our payroll team so the ability to be able to work in a team whilst making autonomous decisions is important for the successful candidate. Your background will be in a similar role, we are looking for someone who has worked in an HRIS role, and experience within SAP/SuccessFactors would be an advantage. You will be data driven and customer focused as this role will liaise not only internally with managers and other key teams but externally with our system provider. Your ability to think outside the box, be detailed orientated and love working with numbers will be some of your strengths. As a key member of the team, this role is pivotal in providing others in the team key information to assist them in doing their job so collaboration is a must. In return for a varied and wide in scope opportunity we offer you the chance to really make this role your own and work with a People and Culture Team about to embark on journey.
"Kua herea mātou ki te whai i te tūturutanga o Te Tiriti O Waitangi." We are committed to creating and maintaining a culturally sensitive work environment in relation to Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
If this sounds like the role for you and you would like to collaborate with a great team register your interest and we will be in touch soon.
Job Reference: 26819
For a copy of the Job Description or to apply visit http://careers.manukau.ac.nz If you would like any further information please contact Alison Redfern Daly, Talent Acquisition Consultant 09 968 8759
Applications close: Sunday 8th March 2020. Please note interviewing may commence before the close date.

If this role sounds like you and you want to join us, please apply now.

Carglass (NZ) Limited is the holding company that includes Smith&Smith®, New Zealand's leading vehicle glass repair and replacement company, and Laser Group whose members are plumbing and electrical experts. We are part of the Belron Group whose 30,000 employees are active in over 30 countries providing services with real care to our customers.
The Smith&Smith® brand has been part of New Zealand's culture since 1875 and is the country's leading vehicle glass repair and replacement company servicing motorists throughout the country at over 60 locations alongside a team of mobile technicians. At Smith&Smith® our focus has always been on people. Our customers, our team, the communities we live in and our role as part of Belron Group is central to our being. So, we're more than a vehicle glass company, we're a thread in the fabric of society working to solve problems with real care.
Laser Group is a network of Plumbing & Electrical companies servicing commercial and residential customers through 70+ cities in New Zealand. They specialise in multi-site projects and service & maintenance management for national customers. Laser provides 'Totally Dependable' solutions and services since 1983.
The purpose of the role
The Insight Analyst is a pivotal member of the Smith&Smith® Business Insight & Pricing team, which is responsible for driving optimal business decision making through providing best-practise operational, financial and pricing insights.
The Insight Analyst is a data specialist, delivering exceptional commercial insights to enable the business to make fully informed decisions. The Insight Analyst is a team player, who challenges the status quo of the organisation and continually strives to deliver best-practice solutions to drive improvements in business performance aligned with our organisation Purpose, Vision and Values.
What will you be doing?
Researching and analysing data from various sources to develop actionable insights that improve our overall business performance and customer experience
Working with the team and key stakeholders across the Group
Working on ad hoc projects which are key in making the Group lead the way in data led decisions
Develop and maintain dashboards and prepare business and operation reports
Prepare business cases and financial models to support change initiatives
Assure data integrity
What do you need to be able to bring?
Curiosity, energy and drive with a down to earth pragmatic personality
Initiative and ability to self-manage whilst being a team player
2 to 3 years' of commercial insights experience in an industry or CA environment
Strong business and data analytics skills (ideally and experienced PowerBI and Cognos/TM1 user in combination with MS Excel)
Excellent communication and time management skills
Problem solving and critical thinking skills
Experience in analysing ERP data (Microsoft Dynamics365 would be an advantage)
What will you get in return?
You'll be joining a diverse and inclusive environment in which all people can come do their best work
Do challenging, varied and interesting work and the opportunity to make a difference
Carglass Life Insurance Plan from day one
Discounted health insurance for you and your family with Southern Cross
Access to an annual Wellbeing fund
We aspire to be the 'best place you will ever work' and take pride in our family-like culture where everyone comes to work with a professional, can do attitude. If this sounds like you, apply now!


Applications Close: 28 Feb 2020

Statisticians: Methods, Design and Analysis
Wellington and/or Christchurch
Permanent roles * Levels - Statistical and Data Analyst, and Design Analyst (Methodologist).
Who are we?
At Stats NZ Tatauranga Aotearoa, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. If you are a passionate and talented person that relishes the idea of becoming part of NZ s data ecosystem, then come join our team!
We are looking for curious and determined people to join our Statistical Methods branch. Our statisticians support the production of official statistics through researching, developing and implementing methods; and providing advice to teams producing the statistics. We have a growing work programme, and you could be working on projects or support to Stats NZ s economic, environmental, household or population statistics; or developing new ways to compile statistics using administrative data and models.
Who are we looking for?
We are hiring at 2 levels.

For the Statistical and Data analysts we are looking for: * A university degree with a major or high component of mathematics, statistics, data science or related subjects
Experience using statistical software e.g. R to extract and analyse data, and the ability to pick up new tools quickly * The ability to advise on statistical methods and calculations, and recommend and implement improvements
The ability to communicate technical information in plain English
The ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships
For Design analysts (Methodologists) we are looking for the above, plus:

2 3 years practical experience resolving conceptually and technically challenging problems * The ability to provide guidance on end to end service delivery and process workflows
Advanced experience using statistical software e.g. R * Experience in understanding customer requirements and translating them in practical terms * Experience mentoring and training other analysts, What s in it for you?
You ll be joining an inclusive environment in which all people, regardless of gender, race, religion or background can come do their best work. Our goal is to provide our staff with a working environment that provides them with the opportunity to:

have challenging, varied and interesting work
work in an agile, dynamic and flexible manner.
develop and grow their careers
balance life and work, and
We care about our people, and value your drive, energy and inquisitive nature.

Statistical and Data analyst salaries start at $65,969 and Design analyst salaries start at $75,721.

Are you interested?
If this job sounds like you, please look at the Position descriptions.

https://bit.ly/2Zd8VB2 (Statistical and Data Analyst)

https://bit.ly/2R3SlAS (Design Analyst).

For more information about these roles please contact Wendy Dobson on 03 964 8950 or wendy.dobson@stats.govt.nz .

For more information about working for us see http://careers.stats.govt.nz

Our purpose

Our Team

Working primarily across the Social and Environment sectors, we take pride in what we do and who we do it for. As a well-established team we have a good mix of senior through to junior- level roles, and we encourage everyone to come to work in their own skin, be yourself and most importantly have fun.
About the Role
We’re looking for a Senior Business Analyst (BA) to join our team and own outcomes with a dedicated customer. You’ll utilize your SDLC expertise along with your general all-round awesome BA skills. This role will involve analytical business analysis, requirements gathering and influencing decisions within the Software Engineering and digital space.
Working within Professional Services line of business, your skills will be used across a wide breadth of challenging and leading edge projects.

Establishing and driving requirements gathering
User experience design
Establishing user personas and journeys

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Andrew Batey

About the role;
The Planning Manager is responsible for the data management and the asset planning integrity on this major portfolio of properties. In this role you will be searching and locating the assets to streamline which require long term plans. This role is predominately office based and most of your time will be spent planning, forecasting and setting the budgets for the following year. In this position your main responsibilities will be, but not limited to:
Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans
Maintaining the ongoing maintenance and upgrades of a single asset management system
Be the escalation point for the outsourced Facilities Managers
The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme
Reviewing quotes and raising purchase orders within your works limit
Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety
The ideal candidate would have the following attributes;
Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment
Sound experience in asset planning, forecasting and budgeting
Key understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental fundamentals
Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen
What's on offer?
A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. The client is close to public transport and is centrally located in the city fringe area. They offer a flexible work environment and have a magnificent building, you will also be working in a collaborative workspace.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
A fantastic opportunity to join a team that is creating a new enterprise scale software product for the NZ and AU market. A career defining role, spanning the initial MVP development through to first customer trials and then on to serious scale as we take the product to market in NZ, Australia and eventually beyond. All this backed by NZ’s largest privately owned IT firm, Datacom.
Built from the ground up to meet our vision of a true cloud app, the tools and tech for the core components are the latest and greatest from the Microsoft stack. With principles of openness and integration at the heart of the design, there is significant use of mobile and IoT platforms in the mix as well.
Our people are a cut-above, passionate about the work they do and completely invested in making this product the success we know it will be.

About the Role
We’re looking for a recent graduate or junior who is ready to kick-start a career within Technology with an interest to specialise in Quality Assurance. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to work on the development of an enterprise software product and learn from Datacom’s experts!

What you’ll do
Join one of the sprint teams and support the development and QA of User Story and Bug tickets that are in that team’s queue
Understand requirements, development design and intended behaviour in order to design and execute QA tests to confirm developed functionality is correct
Manage tickets through status updates and commentary to ensure we deliver the quality outcome our customers are looking for
Assist with issue diagnosis and customer / consultant support requests to ensure we provide outstanding service to our customers.
Assist with system configuration to ensure end users of the application process tasks quickly and accurately
Participate in planning and build activities
What you’ll bring
We’re looking for passionate individuals who can’t wait to get their hands-on the tech and learn with the best. We can teach you the tech skills, but it’s essential you have a positive attitude and strong interpersonal skills. Ideally, you’ll have recently completed a bachelor’s degree, with some exposure to testing, and software development on personal/university projects. If you have a specific interest to develop a career in QA, then this is a great place for you to begin!

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re after, please apply online now!

Software Developer
Position Purpose The Developer is responsible for producing timely and high-quality
developments for applications. This process includes the
development and maintenance of custom applications as well as the
customisation of products from software vendors.

Context: We are a world-leading university in many academic disciplines and fields
of research. Our point of difference is research that is connected to
Massey University community and industry. Our researchers are developing expertise and
skills to advance human knowledge and understanding. Working together
across disciplines and locations, we solve national and global problems
through fundamental, applied and interdisciplinary research, while
culturally and artistically enriching our world.

We are deeply committed to being a Tiriti-led university, demonstrating
authentic leadership in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand as we
uphold Te Tiriti o Waitangi, the founding document of our nation, and its
principles through our practice. We embrace this not just as an obligation
but as a real opportunity for the nation and its people.

Our educators are preparing a new generation of global leaders. Our
students are diverse and are attracted to Massey because they want to
achieve their personal goals or make their mark in the world. They
experience world-class learning that recognises their intellectual and
cultural strengths, expands their horizons and prepares them to
contribute to a rapidly transforming world with skills, critical and creative
thinking and leadership.

We will be renowned for our passion and caring attitude. All Massey
campuses will be innovation ecosystems, acting as magnets for smart
enterprises. Wherever we are, we will operate in partnerships founded on
respect, trust and mutual benefit. Massey is not only defined by what we
do, but by how we do it.
1

Massey core capabilities

At Massey we are Tiriti-led, upholding Te Tiriti o Waitangi principles through our practice, We:
Demonstrate awareness Of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and its contribution to Aotearoa New Zealand
society
Understand the relevance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi in relation to the work of the University and
the people we serve.
Embracing Te Reo in relevant and practical ways in our work place interactions and
engagement with external stakeholders, giving expression to Tikanga Mäori and protocols
that demonstrates that we respect and value Maori conventions in appropriate settings.
At Massey we work together with mutual respect and caring. We:
Act with integrity and trustworthiness and give credit to others for the work they do.
Work cooperatively and inter-dependently to foster and promote the One University approach
Share knowledge and communicate professionally with courtesy and mutual respect.
Are ethical in all transactions, working within the parameters of our policies and procedures.
Are direct, truthful and maintain confidentiality.

After a leader who values training?

Value a strong culture and community focus?
Hi, I’m Stella the Talent Acquisition Manager at Heartland Bank. I have an awesome opportunity I’d love to share with you. Here’s some info:

Is this your next role?

Heartland is looking for a motivated techie to join our growing IT team which is on the precipice of delivering a number of new technologies over a multiyear roadmap, making a real contribution to the wider business and its digital strategy.
You’ll be the threat and forensic subject matter expert to ensure the security of Heartland Bank’s Network. As the threat and forensic SME you’ll:
Conduct security risk assessments of network security devices and lead incident responses.
Monitor and respond to network security control related incidents
Develop business continuity scenarios for security specific incidents
Manage multiple investigation requests through the entire lifecycle of initiation, data collection, analysis, and data production
Facilitate audit and vulnerability analysis of corporate networks, advise and implement appropriate mitigations
Liaise with vendors and technical teams to develop incident remediation plans
Does this sound like you?

You’re passionate about systems security and keen to make your mark.

You’re a pro who:
Understands "attacker" methodologies and tactics.
Is familiar with Advance Persistent Threat groups and Hacker activity.
Has experience analysing phishing attacks
Knows 3rd/4th gen defence & sandboxing toolsets
Is able to read network logs and analyse network packet capture data
Possesses thorough knowledge on PKI, IPS/IDS, DDOS, DLP, NAC, SIEM, Penetration & VA Testing.
Has excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Can influence and lead security directions
Is knowledgeable in web filtering, malware, anti-spam, firewall policies, proxy solutions & intuitive endpoint protection.
Can you see yourself here?

Our Heartland – it’s in our name. Heartland is about the things that matter most to our people, our customers, our communities and our shareholders.

For our people, our Heartland means respecting and valuing the diverse backgrounds we all bring. We encourage and support each other, working together to tackle challenges and to reach our goals. We’re determined to go above and beyond.

We may be small but our ambitions, like our hearts, are big. We embrace the new, we’re nimble and flexible allowing us to adapt in a heartbeat. While others are still pondering, we’re already hard at work. We innovate, and execute at speed, providing our customers with access to opportunities that make a real difference to them.

Heartland offers unbeatable employee Insurance Benefits as well as loads of work perks for your enjoyment.

Ready to get stuck in and make that difference? Get in touch!

BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST – TRANSPORT LOGISTICS
This role desires a strong communicator with advanced technical skills, who can confidently collate, present and explain data to all levels of the business and its diverse team of people ranging from the warehouse, finance, commercial and operations teams.
This role will support the NZ & Australian Management Team in the analytics required for new business implementation and management of master data, existing business analytics, operational and management dashboards, and carrier KPI reporting. You will be accountable for delivering outstanding customer service, quality decision making including reporting.
Your CV should display competencies in the following areas:
Experience in domestic and international freight Business Analytics, Economics, Marketing and Operations Management
Knowledge and experience with SQL development and the implementation of SSRS reporting.
Advanced MS Office Excel, and knowledge of Power BI, Plato TMS or similar systems to generate KPI, decision support and other reports.
Display sound judgement in selecting data and information to support robust decisions.
Experience in managing master data, business process, policy and procedure control documents.
Demonstrate Customer Service Focus, adapting to service levels and styles of customers.
A knowledge and understanding of the principles of Road, Rail & International shipping and Transport Service Delivery through use of optimisation and work flow systems and use of capacity available from carriers.
A relevant tertiary qualification (Bachelors or higher degree in mathematics, IT) or equivalent experience working in role that developed knowledge of business support and reporting capabilities would be an advantage. All applicants must hold a valid NZ work permit, be a NZ Resident or Citizen.

Ref: 534

Collections Analyst

Permanent full-time role

Design Team (Field Collections)

Auckland

We have an exciting opportunity available in our Design Team within the Field Collections Unit of Collection Operations. If you have experience working on process improvement initiatives, provide insights into data collection best practice, skilled in research and analysis and have excellent communication skills then this role could be for you!

, The purpose of the role
We are looking for a person who can work on collection projects to improve collection performance and respondent experience as well as undertake complex analysis and research.

Each team in Collection Analysis and Support has a range of skills, strengths and knowledge, and is led by a Senior Collections Analyst. Some of the responsibilities include leading the development and implementation of innovative initiatives, advanced collections analysis and modelling, and providing support to management and operational areas.

,
Who we are
Stats NZ Tatauranga Aotearoa is New Zealand s official data and statistics agency. Our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. We lead the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment and we are looking for an experienced analyst who can lead research initiatives and teams.

The Collection Operations branch is at the forefront of sustainable data sourcing from businesses and households across NZ. This integrated Design team are experts in the on-the-ground practical world of data collections. Much of the Team s work will inform the future Survey Collection Approaches that they will design / create. The Design Team will consult within Collection Operations and engage with our Stakeholders and the wider-organisation when they are creating these future Collection Approaches, processes and systems. We are looking for a person who can work on collection projects to improve collection performance and provide complex analysis and research to enable decision making

,

As a Collections Analyst, you will:
Contribute to initiatives that add value and advance data discovery, sourcing and sustainable collection * Provide advanced analysis and research into paradata * Assess and report on the impact of proposed changes on our business of data collection (e.g. methods, costs, processes, work volumes) * Liaise and build relationships across the Collection Operations management and operational teams. * Support the Design team and wider Collections Leadership with key papers
,
Person specifications
To be successful in this role you ll need to be enthusiastic, driven, and able to hit the ground running. If you have the following, we want to hear from you:
Technical, research and analytical skills (e.g. Excel, SAS, SQL or R programming, analysis and data modelling, business process improvement) * Knowledge of data collection and able to offer insight for its advancement * Fantastic interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to interact across all levels within the organisation * A relevant tertiary qualification, preferably with a degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, accountancy, business, data or computer science * A minimum of 5 years relevant experience is desirable.
, What s in it for you?
We care about our people, and value your drive, energy and inquisitive nature.
If you are a passionate and talented person seeking to add value every day and relishes the idea of becoming part of NZ s data system, then come join our team!

For more information about this role please contact Lorna Curran (lorna.curran@stats.govt.nz)

Applications close on 22 February 2020, 17:00pm.
For more about working for us see http://careers.stats.govt.nz/

THE COMPANY:
Our client are a well- established and respected transport and logistics company who are innovative and in growth mode.
THE ROLE:
Working in a team, the Technical Business Analyst will have a focus on retrieving the analytics required for new business implementation and management of master data, they will also look after existing business analytics, operational and management dashboards and customer and carrier KPI Reporting.
Further responsibilities are as follows:
Domestic and international freight related data mining, analytics and presentation for opportunity identification, quantification and validation.
Develop, design and implement operational dashboards, for new and existing customers via the KPI reporting framework (decision support systems).
Manage and analyse data structure and quality on a continuous basis.
Use ETL tools to load data store(s)/ data warehouse(s)/ data mart(s).
Transition developed BI systems to the Operations & Support team in Australia and New Zealand.
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of enterprise data and BI environments for both external and internal users.
Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence.
Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members.
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes.
Maintain accurate technical and business documentation.
YOU WILL BE:
A strong communicator with advanced technical skills, a confident presenter and create a good rapport with anyone you come into contact with. You would like to work alongside a diverse range of people from warehouse employees right through to management. It is compulsory that you have SSRS experience, SQL coding and previous experience in a similar role.
Please apply if you have this experience or we are also interested in seeing people who are on a intermediate level with 3-5 years work experience.

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

The Principal Strategic Analyst works under the guidance of the General Manager Research and Analysis to provide comprehensive analysis, insights, and advice for impacts on all aspects of the business strategy. You will work collaboratively and collegially with national office colleagues and managers to ensure that high-quality analysis and advice is co-ordinated within the business group reporting to DCE Maori.
As a Principal Strategic Analyst you'll use your strength in future focused analytical thinking. This is a great opportunity to make an impact and exert influence and direction of Ara Poutama Aotearoa.

Knowledge of New Zealand's criminal justice system
A relevant tertiary qualification
Why work for us?
First and foremost, you'll be part of a team making a real difference for New Zealand. You will also benefit from:

Excellent training programmes and development opportunities
Industry competitive salary
Exposure across one of NZ's largest Government departments
This position is based in the Research and Analysis team branch within Ara Poutama, Aotearoa

About us
Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential. Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities.
It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.

You will be using data analytics to provide intelligence to manage both immediate risks as well as provide advice on the financial crime landscape and future risks. As a Financial Crime analyst, you’ll be a numerically minded individual who is comfortable discussing your work, explaining your findings and recommending responses within a fast paced and constantly evolving environment.

Strong skills in SQL, R, SAS

Providing support and advice on campaign tagging and additional on-site tracking
Spotting potential to implement innovative new methodologies and improve analytical procedure
Communicate effectively with relevant stakeholders to successfully optimise opportunities to drive revenue and traffic
Ensure internal relationships are effectively managed and with effective communication where appropriate and attendance at required team meetings across the business

Senior Insights Analyst
Enhance your career with a group of like-minded professionals
Contribute to a High-Performing Analytics Team
Exciting Opportunity in a Government Agency
Proud to be working alongside one of Wellington's leading Government Agencies hiring a Senior Insights Analyst who will help drive improvements in New Zealand.
The Company
This Government Agency wants to improve quality of life by creating a unique partnership with every New Zealander. This organisation has fair and open values and puts people before processes.
The Team
The team will be responsible for using data, insights and analytics to provide the necessary tools to bring together different data sources and enable better decision making. They are committed to providing excellent quality work up to a high standard.
The Role
As a senior in this team you will be using statistics, robust programming, data mining, data story telling techniques and business knowledge within a high performance team to bring meaning to data. The deliverables are about improving the quality of life of every New Zealander.
Some accountabilities will include:
Identifying and analysing trends and relationships in data using appropriate analysis techniques.
Producing data stories, insights and evidence that drive change and improvement.
Developing SAS code for the extraction, manipulation and computation of data to enhance and extract value.
Assisting in the development of advanced analytics solutions to drive marketing and campaign strategies.
Managing and delivering data and analytics projects to agreed timelines, budget and scope.
Working with large data sets from different sources and being able to work with big data concepts.
Utilising appropriate project management techniques including Kanban and Agile principles.
Collaborating and working effectively as part of broader project and organisational teams.
Experience
This role needs a capable senior with excellent capabilities in leading a team in a Data Insights and Analytics capacity. Being a part of the continuous development of the team is a major component so great communication skills, patience and a drive to deliver a quality service are important. Someone who can easily join a high energy team who do a lot of work. Being trustworthy and being able to get on with their projects independently, and up to the standard of the team and the organisation.

For more information please contact Conor Smyth on 04 495 1385 or email through to conor.smyth@randstad.co.nz

Do you have a passion for information, insights, data and emerging technologies? Are you passionate about working with stakeholders and identifying how new data technologies can impact and improve an organisation’s decision making?

Your new company

Ngā mōhiohio e pā hānga ki tēnei mahi (About this position)

Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)

Data analysis experience, ideally within the R or tableau environments;
Experience in supporting improvement projects;
Knowledge of the current thinking around continuous quality improvement within the health care sector desirable;
The ability to develop and maintain effective interpersonal relationships at all levels;
Plenty of enthusiasm with a proactive attitude and a focus on outcomes
Current driver’s license.
Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)
Nelson Marlborough Health (NMH) is the main health service provider for New Zealand’s Nelson, Tasman and Marlborough regions, serving over 150,000 people across two main hospitals, public health and a range of community services.

It’s amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee. At JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS, we’ve made it our mission to find out.
