Who is RUSH?
We are an integrated design + technology studio.
We're a squad of strategic thinkers, empathetic designers and technical mavericks.
We’re united by our love of technology and its potential for making lives better. Some of us are big picture thinkers, some of us creatively driven. And some of us love nothing more than deep diving into a thorny technical challenge. But we’re all human, inspired by human stories and driven by a desire to create human-centred experiences.
We're chasing down the future. We design and engineer exciting new ways to engage with the world's challenges, big or small. Sometimes they're business challenges, sometimes they're about being better humans. But we get the same rush from taking them on.
Love making things for people to enjoy? Join the team designing the technology that matters.
What matters to us?
Put people first - It's about the people, not the tech.
Push the boundaries - Who wants to do what's been done already?
Play the long game - We create sustainable solutions, not quick fixes.
Say it like it is - Life's too short for miscommunication.
Live for the RUSH - Nothing's more exciting than the rush of doing and discovering.
Requirements
We are looking for someone with a background in leading and mentoring a team who can work closely with the team to ensure they are upskilling and developing their skills as BA's.
We are looking for someone who has:
Proven track record in a Business Analyst / Product Analyst/ Product Owner role
Ideally a technical / IT background with experience in UX, Development, Testing or Analytics
Management of the team of Business analysts, managing resourcing, escalations, recruitment and team development.
Leading the Rush BA practice, defining the BA strategy, approach and handling project resourcing and support demands across the the different project teams.
Attention to detail to create high quality user stories, use cases, data models, workflows with multiple context scenarios
Able to apply agile analysis techniques specifically for defining and creating user stories and acceptance criteria
Experience of using analysis tools & techniques including wireframes and business process modelling
Well versed with reading and writing specifications and test cases – strong evidence of having drafted or analysed APIs/Web Services
Experience of using work management tools such as Jira and Confluence
Excellent presentation skills, with prior experience presenting to senior managers within a business
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to challenge effectively at all levels, and confident pushing back where required for optimal and balanced outcomes between cost, time and quality
Confident with all aspects of consumer experience mapping, business process analysis and requirements elicitation
The ability to plan and work flexibly to multiple deadlines
Solid experience of Agile delivery techniques, particularly utilising Scrum frameworks
Previous product analysis experience gained either in house or within a consultancy
Previous experience designing digital customer experiences, across channels
Strong stakeholder management techniques and with a demonstrable track record
Passion for working collaboratively within and thriving in a multi-disciplinary team environment
Experience of market leading technology packages e.g. content management, eCommerce, search, social, mobile
Bonus skills & experience
Judgement: Digital product teams are empowered to make strong data-driven decisions, but as a successful Product Analyst you’ll also know when it is important to seek support or other viewpoints.
Drive: You’ll be working with and facilitating sessions with a team of bright, energetic specialists. The right person will have plenty of drive to keep the team moving smoothly, looking ahead to remove/resolve any potential obstacles/dependencies in good time.
Influence: Some problems are best solved with others. By involving others in problem solving, we often bring people together. The successful candidate will be able to spot potential barriers to success, and have experience in using soft skills to break these barriers down.
Benefits
What's The Company Culture Like? What Are The People Like?
Put simply, our office culture is awesome!

It has a start-up buzz, it's youthful, we have lots of social events, we have cake days, fruit days, lunch put-on frequently - put simply, we have a lot of fun together. We also invest in your ongoing training and development with regular goal-setting, group training, lunch and learns and personalised development plans.

We have a very flat structure. You can spark up a conversation with the CEO or anyone in senior management and they'll treat you like family. No staff politics. Not egos, no BS. I promise!
If you've read this far, you're probably interested in the job. If you meet the criteria, want to supercharge your career and work in an environment that cares more about you than your mum does, APPLY FOR THE ROLE - we want to meet you!

Applications are open for a very short time. We'll be making a decision fast so spruce up your CV and send it over - but if you are organised, it will be updated already!
PLEASE NOTE: We have a shut down period between 24th December and 13th January. If you don't hear from us before this period then we will be in touch in the new year.

Permanent role; Flexible work options; flexi-hours, flexi-place
Latest techniques in development, scrum, and agile
Join one of NZ’s largest technology shops, offering career scope and opportunity
About the role
The mission of the Data & Analytics technology team is to deliver quality, reusable data for our business. This role is working part of a team that focuses on improving the way we deliver via automation, performance enhancements, CI/CD and more.
As a Developer within the ANZ Data & Analytics team you will work collaboratively with high-performing Agile teams.
You will undertake analysis, and be involved in design and specification of system changes.
An integral part of this role will be to identify improvement opportunities, code, test and implement enhancements and fixes, and provide operational support.
Be involved in the continuous improvements of both the platform (processes and systems) and the team’s ways of working (DevOps/Agile).
Role Location: Wellington CBD
Role Type: Permanent

About you
You will have a wide breath of interests and experience, from databases to applications.
You will be an enthusiastic learner who questions the status quo and enjoys problem solving.
You will be a communicator, and enjoy spending your day working alongside other developers, testers, business analysts, and product owners.
You will have the ability to communicate complex technical issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.
You will enjoy working in small teams where collaboration and relationship building is key. We are interested in people who enjoy a dynamic, rapidly changing environment, who don’t get attached to a particular technology or practice and importantly who want to drive change in the organisation.
You will be passionate about writing modular, well tested, code that follows good software development principles.
You will have proven experience working as a Developer in agile environments, and be excited by the opportunity to contribute to the ongoing improvement of development processes, tools, strategy, and methodology.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Database and/or application experience
Strong interest and understanding of DevOps including Openshift, CI/CD, Automation, optimisation of environments
Solid understanding of good software engineering principles and practices for keeping a codebase of high maintainability.
Experience with automated testing
Experience with scrum or other Agile practices.
A rigorous and logical approach to problem solving, clear communication skills and excellent time management.


Some of our other benefits include:
Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
Southern Cross Health Insurance

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Andrew Batey

About the role;

In this role you will be searching and locating the assets to streamline which require long term plans. Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans

The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme

Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety

Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment
Sound experience in asset planning, forecasting and budgeting
Key understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental fundamentals
Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen

A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. The client is close to public transport and is centrally located in the city fringe area. They offer a flexible work environment and have a magnificent building, you will also be working in a collaborative workspace.

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Andrew Batey

H2R Technology has an exciting, newly created role, in a well-known New Zealand brand who lead the market with their disruptive presence and Kiwi-centric personality. Our client believes in becoming a world leader and to do so believes in empowering their people and giving their employees a reason to belong by enabling growth and personal development. Our client is on a journey to gain a deep understanding of their customer’s behaviour and motivations to aid in delivering a world class customer experience. This is a newly created role to join an expanding team to support and strengthen a drive to harness and use data in more ways throughout the business.

The Role:
Working closely with the Data Solutions Manager you’ll optimise data flows and collection for cross functional teams. You’ll also support our software developers, data architect, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and ensure our data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

Responsibilities:

Data Solution Development
Own the creation of component design for larger data solutions
Responsible for solution design & delivery in alignment with Digital architectural roadmaps
Provide technical expertise within the Data Solutions team
Work with Digital architecture team to ensure consistency in solution delivery
Work with third parties and suppliers to ensure data meets our agreed standards of accuracy and availability

Ownership of data solution initiatives from inception to solution

Responsible for the delivery of data solutions initiatives using a collaborative agile approach

Cloud Data Technology Adoption
Identify, design, and implement the development of standards and best practices for data solutions
Lead DevOps practices and tooling for the Data Solutions team
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
Create data tooling for engineering and data science roles that enable them to build and optimize our products
Keep current with technology and industry changes and contribute to discussion to improve existing solutions

Leadership & Delivery
Lead, mentor and grow the team
Provide thought leadership for our digital enterprise data architecture and enable a team culture of experimentation and early adoption for new data approaches & technologies

Must Haves:
6+ years’ experience in a senior technical role
2+ years’ experience and strong skills in cloud technologies (Azure pref.)
Previous experience building, mentoring and leading a high performing technical team
Excellent communication and influencing skills; demonstrated ability to build trust and communicate to technical and non-technical employees
Ability to manage conflicting priorities across a varied program of work
Ability to demonstrate problem solving and communication skills

Candidates with a relevant and valid New Zealand Work Visa, Permanent Residency or New Zealand Citizenship will be considered for this role.

Job_title: Sr Associate Privacy and Compliance Analyst
Summary:
Join our team and experience Workday!
It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.
Job Description
Are you a self-motivated risk and compliance professional looking to join one of the hottest cloud companies in the world? Do you enjoy building and managing compliance programs in fast paced and rapidly growing environments?
As a member of the growing Privacy, Ethics and Compliance team at Workday, you will help build and manage programs designed to protect our customers' most sensitive data.
The Enterprise Technology Compliance Senior Associate is an important part of Workday’s compliance function. This position is responsible for ensuring that company practices, policies and processes are performed in accordance with contractual and compliance requirements. In this role you will leverage your technology compliance and relationship management experience to help Workday’s continual growth in security and privacy compliance certifications and programs.
Skills and Experience:
2+ years of experience in an equivalent technology risk and compliance related role
Familiarity with Cloud Computing and Software as a Service, particularly risk models and controls related to these services; familiarity with industry compliance standards such as ISO27001, SOC1 (SSAE18) and NIST
Experience coordinating and working with others to meet key project milestones, with the ability to prioritize work in a fast-paced environment
Experience facilitating and/or performing security and compliance audits; industry-specific regulatory compliance knowledge, a plus
Capability to speak articulately to technical and operational processes
Experience implementing and improving operational processes; can drive program efficiency and high customer satisfaction
Keen attention to detail and accuracy
Demonstrated program/project management experience; ability to juggle multiple projects and organize time effectively
Strong communications skills, both written and oral
Proven ability to think critically while maintaining operational efficiency
Organized, responsive, and able to gain support and consensus with cross-functional stakeholders
University degree
CISA, CISSP, CIPP/E, PMP or other relevant certifications a plus
Responsibilities:
Coordinate compliance and audit programs across multiple teams, including operations, security and development
Manage communications with third parties, including customers, partners and vendors, regarding Workday’s operational processes and key controls
Act as the primary liaison for compliance engagements with various Workday stakeholders
Assist in the management of external compliance audit activities
Develop and implement internal policies and procedures in support of Workday's compliance initiatives
Review new product features to determine impact to compliance programs
Execute formal risk assessments of projects, initiatives, technologies and processes

About the role

An integral part of this role will be to identify improvement opportunities, code, test and implement enhancements and fixes, and provide operational support.

Role Type: Permanent

About you
You will have a wide breath of interests and experience, from databases to applications.
You will be an enthusiastic learner who questions the status quo and enjoys problem solving.
You will be a communicator, and enjoy spending your day working alongside other developers, testers, business analysts, and product owners.
You will have the ability to communicate complex technical issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.
You will enjoy working in small teams where collaboration and relationship building is key. We are interested in people who enjoy a dynamic, rapidly changing environment, who don’t get attached to a particular technology or practice and importantly who want to drive change in the organisation.
You will be passionate about writing modular, well tested, code that follows good software development principles.
You will have proven experience working as a Developer in agile environments, and be excited by the opportunity to contribute to the ongoing improvement of development processes, tools, strategy, and methodology.

About ANZ
Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.
The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.


Integrity – We are honest and fair
Collaboration – We work together for the customer
Accountability – We take ownership and get things done
Respect – We care for all those we serve
Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

About the role;
The Planning Manager is responsible for the data management and the asset planning integrity on this major portfolio of properties. In this role you will be searching and locating the assets to streamline which require long term plans. This role is predominately office based and most of your time will be spent planning, forecasting and setting the budgets for the following year. In this position your main responsibilities will be, but not limited to:
Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans
Maintaining the ongoing maintenance and upgrades of a single asset management system
Be the escalation point for the outsourced Facilities Managers
The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme
Reviewing quotes and raising purchase orders within your works limit
Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety
The ideal candidate would have the following attributes;
Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment
Sound experience in asset planning, forecasting and budgeting
Key understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental fundamentals
Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen
What's on offer?
A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. The client is close to public transport and is centrally located in the city fringe area. They offer a flexible work environment and have a magnificent building, you will also be working in a collaborative workspace.

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Andrew Batey

Roles like this do not come around often. If you are seeking an opportunity where you can apply your commercial skills to a ground-breaking, agile, do-good organisation, then this could be the role for you.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The primary purpose of this role is to deliver excellent outcomes by providing expert advice, product enhancement design, some implementation consultancy and training to both existing and new customers. You will also work closely with customer stakeholders, users and the build team on a day-to-day basis to convert ideas and concepts into prioritised work items. Typical activities include requirements gathering, user story and backlog creation, prioritisation, technical dependency mapping, client expectation management, workshop planning and facilitation. Ultimately, you will be the owner of delivering functional outcomes for our customers.
You’ll need to have great organisational & communication skills and the ability to plan ahead if you want to be successful with us. Working across New Zealand (and potentially in Australia) there will be some travel required.
Duties and responsibilities
Gather requirements, design and document a solution approach, gain validation and sign-off from the customer, maintain functional specifications, support the build process through to implementation.
Contribute to the drafting of statements of work, including estimation of Functional Design or Implementation activities, review of team estimates, drafting and review of SOW documents
Provide some tier 2/3 application support for customers for issue resolution (for prioritised issues)
Provide leadership and guidance for customers and team members in the area of:
Business Analysis and best practice
Solution design and implementation
Project delivery
What you’ll bring
You will need to have a strong combination of skills and experiences across traditional BA tasks and toolsets, have ability to communicate with stakeholders to elicit requirements and carefully manage expectations across a wide stakeholder group. You will ideally have a good understanding of project delivery approaches in either agile or waterfall with a passion for ensuring a great customer experience and outcome, along with that a mind-set that continually analyses digital technology from how the end-customer will be using it. You will identify areas of value, root out pain points, and be the interface between the product team and the customer. You will enjoy acquiring knowledge and experience in the local government domain. You will ensure good usability practices which are crucial for excelling in this role.
Key Requirements
Passionate about good design and improving user experience (essential)
Top-notch facilitation, presentation, documentation and communication skills (essential)
Strong business engagement and facilitation skills (essential)
Microsoft tools (essential)
Agile experience (preferred)
Leading/taking part in change programmes in a corporate environment (preferred)
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, Asia, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

We seek the skill and experience of a HelpDesk professional, to support our customer on a 3-month contract. Based in Canterbury, they offer patient-centred integrated health care. If you think innovatively, build strong relationships, and have a ‘can-do’ attitude, this is the role for you.
You'll interact with customers via phone and email, as well as on site at their offices around Canterbury, to provide a seamless customer experience. You'll deal with a variety of queries; from identifying customer needs and requests and providing bespoke support plus loads more. As you'll be dealing with such variety, you will need to be confident using multiple systems and working at speed.
About you
Do you have the following:
Experience providing great customer service
An attraction for technology and navigating different systems
A natural interest in helping people, and know how to build relationships quickly
Excellent communication skills - you're a natural on the phone and can master a great email
To thrive in this role you’ll have:
Sound customer service experience - preferably call centre
Ability to multi task and prioritise
Attention to detail
A high degree of accuracy and good data entry skills
Great written and oral communication skills
Sound knowledge of MS Office Suite, MicroSoft Server and SQL
IT qualifications such as A+, MCSA, Cisco CCNA
A full New Zealand drivers licence

We are looking for an intuitive Credit Risk Manager
Be part of implementing to new legislative changes in FY20 & FY21 (CCCFA)

About The Role

In this role, you would have the opportunity to:
Provide leadership on risk strategy and responsible lending standards across the credit life cycle of the business banking portfolio

Position Summary & Environment
The Operations Engineer works as a part of the Operations team and is responsible for providing technical expertise while delivering 1st to 3rd line support to the global users of the C3 SaaS system. The primary focus for this position is on the operational requirements and service to C3 users and identifying opportunities for improvement in the application, processes, and capability.
This role involves the handling of client queries (via email or phone), analysis on problems, technical troubleshooting, and the designing and implementation of technical solutions. You will be responsible for client integration tasks including on-boarding and new configuration development. This role is also responsible for the monitoring of the C3 system’s health. This includes investigating and resolving issues with database performance, application accessibility, functionality, and data integrity across multiple platforms and technologies. You will work alongside a team of experienced .NET developers to assist with the development and maintenance of the C3 system.
This position is highly responsive to the requests of internal stakeholders with work priorities largely influenced by these stakeholders. This role covers an overnight shift and work across time zones is frequently required. ICM runs 24 hours a day, you will be expected to work rotational shifts.
Significant Working Relationships
Internal
Operations / Project Management Office
Development Team
Business Analyst Team
Quality Assurance Team
Architecture Team
Infrastructure Team
UK Client Service / Management Team
DevOps Team
External
Clients
Position Responsibilities
The C3 SaaS application has a SOA design run on a Microsoft stack, currently using; .NET Framework, Microsoft SQL database, ASP.NET, XML, JavaScript, AJAX, and DHTML. The system also utilises BizTalk as the applications integration platform of data, and MSMQ as a messaging service. The ICM group also work with Microsoft Office products such as Outlook and Excel and Workfront is used as a work management product.
These technologies are used by the Operations Engineer in the below responsibilities:
Operational Tasks
Monitoring, investigating, and resolving system alerts, exceptions, and health check service alerts to ensure the application if fully operational.
Monitoring and actioning of overdue data files to be received from third parties.
Regularly reviewing and keeping work items on the Operations team work list up to date.
Renewing and purchasing C3 application users’ digital certificates via the GlobalSign service.
Maintaining and updating data source configuration for data file pick up and processing.
Perform the loading of monthly data for billing clients and investigate any data issues.
Monitoring of automated Unit / BizUnit tests and application / database builds on TeamCity.
Assistance of UK team of loading data into Preview / Test environments.
Processing of Invalid Data
Handling of invalid data file formats received – updating configuration to cater for file format or liaising with file owners to resolve issues.
Handling Suspended Instances in BizTalk which are due to invalid files or messages.
Updating missing / new enrichment codes in the database, used to represent different organisations in C3.
Client Queries
Acknowledging and logging all client queries into Workfront.
Investigating, troubleshooting, and analysing all client queries received on the Operations inbox
Resolving all client requests and issues or escalating to senior members when required.
Ensuring clients are regularly updated on their queries and issues.
Development & Implementation
Updating and creating new data sources for the pickup and processing of third party data files.
Updating and creating parsing configuration used for transforming data from csv / excel files to a database readable format.
Updating and creating configuration used for processing data activities via XML templates into the C3 application.
On-boarding of new clients to the C3 platform – creation of organisations and users into the database.
Investigating and debugging system exceptions and implementing solutions working alongside Development and Architecture teams
Developing tools and system enhancements for improving client usability of the C3 application and Operational requirements for internal processes.
Testing
Updating and creating automated tests for new changes and database objects. This involves in evaluating the proposed changes and working with the wider team to understand the required testing.
Working with QA, Development, and Architecture teams as a zero-defect strategy based on test-driven development to ensure all live changes are accurate and stable.
Continuous Improvement
Identify and introduce industry Best Practice standards in all projects, work requests and responsibilities in terms of processes in the Operations team.
Seek to educate team members and stakeholders about Best Practice where appropriate.
Work Planning and Management
Work with the ICM Project Managers to meet deadlines under all relevant project plans.
Manage daily tasks and projects to ensure work is completed consistent with assigned priorities and deadlines.
Provide timely updates to task progression to the Operations team, Managers, and relevant members of the wider team.
Occupational Health & Safety
Responsible for taking reasonable care to ensure own safety and health at work, and to avoid adversely affecting the safety or health of any other person at work.
Responsibilities on Demand
Due to the fluid and dynamic environment within the group, new, additional or amended position responsibilities may be required at any time.
Successful demonstration of change orientation is an ongoing responsibility of all positions.
Key Result Areas
Complete all assigned tasks in a timely manner.
Communication with clients and internal members is done with utmost professionalism.
All other internal and client-facing regular deliverables (which are not projects themselves) to be achieved on time and to the required standard.
Ensure all actions directly support the company objectives, values, polices and processes.
Person Specification Qualifications
A tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Systems (or similar) - preferably with a Software Development major.
Preferred Skills and Experience
Formal training in Programming fundamentals (e.g. language semantics, best practice, patterns) would be preferred.
Experience in a support environment and knowledge of service delivery methodologies.
Technical Expertise
Demonstrate expertise in or understanding of:
.Net Framework 4+
ASP.Net
WCF Web Services
Visual Studio 2013+
SQL Server 2008+
Personal Competencies/Attributes
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Work well in a close-knit team
Problem Solving
Flexible and adaptable
Innovative
Self-managing, proactive
Motivated
Results driven
Professional
Sense of humour

A rare and exciting opportunity for a Principal Analyst.
Your new company
A rare and exciting opportunity has arisen for a Principal Analyst to guide and support the development of the Climate Change Operations within a large central Government department in Wellington, New Zealand.

Your new role
The Principal Analyst role within Climate Change Operations is the key source of expertise on forest carbon accounting and reporting. You will have the unique opportunity to take technical and regulatory responsibility for world-leading, national-scale forest carbon assessment. You will contribute to the leadership of the climate change operations environment and lead delivery of all aspects of carbon accounting and reporting for forestry participants on behalf of the New Zealand Government.

What you'll need to succeed


Strong technical knowledge and experience in large-scale, operational forest inventory, growth modelling and carbon allocation – and be familiar with the associated science and technology.
Experience in operational forestry data analysis, interpretation and quality assurance, and in providing technical solutions, advice and training.
Prior responsibility in a strong regulatory/government role, relating to exercise of legislation or regulations.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Proven experience in effectively communicating technical and complex information to a wide variety of audiences in clear, understandable terms.

What you'll get in return


Work Visa and Relocation Assistance
This government organisation is an accredited employer in New Zealand and for eligible applicants, the organisation are able to offer a Talent (Accredited Employer) Work Visa. This visa is a pathway for individuals looking to live and work in New Zealand, and after two years with the employer, applicants are able to apply for New Zealand Permanent Residency.
On offer of employment, the organisation will arrange a work visa and up to $10,000 NZD towards relocation.

The Project Specialist - Business Analyst is responsible for working with the Core People Operations Leads to provide a level of service excellence across all operational processes and procedures whilst maintaining the development and delivery of the Core People Operations work plan.

In this role, you will be responsible for the following:
Supporting People and Capability Core People Operations development, ensuring processes are efficient and effective and maintenance of processes and procedures is aligned with best practice controls
Supporting People and Capability HRIS development, ensuring processes are efficient and effective and maintenance of systems is aligned with best practice controls
Working with the Core People Operations Team Leads and team members to identify service improvements and agree and implement improvement programmes and plans as required
Ensuring data quality is high and systems data is appropriately managed and maintained
Supporting and working closely with the Team Leads to ensure outcomes are achieved as we implement our programme of change.
Undertaking analysis and prepare proposals, reporting and analytics as required and as agreed with the Head of Core People Operations
Your skills will include the following:
Extensive business support and analysis experience in a large organisation
The ability to quickly develop and maintain relationships with a broad range of people
Ideally at least five years' business process/technology experience
Strong communication skills - the ability to communicate variety of stakeholders from governance through to end users also external with vendors
An analytical background
Working knowledge of programming, system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts, especially as they apply in an HRIS context.
Knowledge of health environments would be preferable
Our Culture: What matters to us
Ko ngā tāngata, te mātua mahiPutting people at the heart of all we do
Health is ultimately all about people. What's important around here is the way we care for and respect others, the responsibility taken for delivering outcomes, and going about our work with integrity.
Belonging Here: Becoming part of our story
Being part of the Canterbury District Health Board, you will enjoy a fantastic benefits scheme, the opportunity for flexible working arrangements and ongoing focus on your career development.
The Canterbury DHB believes that diversity and inclusion is key to ensure we deliver the best care for our diverse population. The Canterbury DHB is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that welcomes and respects everyone.
If this role has sparked your interest but does not match your skills then please visit our careers website and have a look at our roles that better suit your expertise.
If you are interested in this role please apply directly on our career site. Please note only applications submitted via our career site will be accepted.
Contact us on recruitment@cdhb.health.nz for additional information.

We seek an energetic self-starter with design skills and experience in process improvement, for a highly regarded national organisation. The role is based in Central Christchurch at fantastic new offices, within a vibrant and growing city quarter.

To be successful in this role, you will have the ability to understand, analyse and improve on business processes. You will enjoy working to deadlines and be able to apply strategic thinking and sound judgement under pressure. In return for your skill and talent, you will have the opportunity to:
Influence the design and development of field operations methodology, systems and processes
Work with an eager team hungry to learn from and improve processes
Having a positive attitude is key for this role and we seek a Design Analyst who:
Is a tenacious, hard worker who is happy to work with ambiguity and change
Is naturally open with a communicative working style
Enjoys working with a wide variety of stakeholders
Is comfortable working on a high profile projects
Technical skills in data, maths and statistics are a bonus. A tertiary qualification involving analysis, process design or statistics would be beneficial. This role is for a 5 month fixed term and comes with an excellent salary package.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
This role will provide proactive financial assistance and expertise to the PSG group. The focus being to ensure all orders are invoiced and vendor bills are generated and processed in a timely manner, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of PSG’s operational and financial reports.
What you’ll bring
Financial Acumen
Datacom Business Processes
Inventory Management Knowledge
Customer Contractual Commitments
Vendor Focus and Strategy
Vendor/Distributor Operational Process
Business Systems Knowledge
Organisational Development
Relationship Management
Time Management
Responsibilities
Manual and Partial Billing – raising manual billing for customers in a timely manner and providing journal and accrual assistance where necessary.
Un-invoiced Escalation – monitoring and escalating invoices that have not been processed.
Vendor Bill Escalation – monitoring and escalating vendor bills that have not been processed.
Scan and Capture Processing and Monitoring
3 Way Match Tolerance Override
End of Month Billing tasks.
Finance Liaison
Sales report by Margin by Salesperson review and remediation
CRA (Customer Return Authorisation) and VRA (Vendor Return Authorisation) Management – ensuring process is followed and is complete.
Why you want to join us

At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

Diverse role within a highly dynamic & sociable team
Well known FMCG company
Career progression
A great opportunity has arisen with a fantastic FMCG organisation. This permanent full time position is based in City Fringe.

Key focus areas:
Work collaboratively with key business partners to build and maintain strong relationships, transforming data in to insightful and financial data to support and enable quality decisions
Support the project team to continuously improve supply chain finance processes and drive results
Complete monthly business unit performance reporting and analysis, identifying insights, risks and opportunities
Change management of people and system impact following recent implementation of SAP
With a background in Finance, you'll have previous experience of working within an analytical role within a complex environment such as FMCG, Manufacturing or Retail. You'll be a real 'problem solver', exploring all avenues to figure out how things work and fit together. With a passion for analytics and continuous improvement, you'll leave no stone unturned to transfer data into meaningful reports.
Exposure to a system implementation or ERP project would be extremely beneficial as would knowledge of using BI and SAP.

For more information, please contact Sherry Zeng for a confidential discussion on (09) 307 4880 or email zeng@ocg.co.nz.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.
Contact:
Andrew Batey

Programmed Professionals are one of Australasia's largest and longest serving technical and professional recruitment providers. We are currently recruiting for one of our prestigious clients within New Zealand.
Please click to apply or contact Natalie at Programmed Professionals on 03 341 4140 for a confidential discussion.
About the role;
The Planning Manager is responsible for the data management and the asset planning integrity on this major portfolio of properties. In this role you will be searching and locating the assets to streamline which require long term plans. This role is predominately office based and most of your time will be spent planning, forecasting and setting the budgets for the following year. In this position your main responsibilities will be, but not limited to:
Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans
Maintaining the ongoing maintenance and upgrades of a single asset management system
Be the escalation point for the outsourced Facilities Managers
The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme
Reviewing quotes and raising purchase orders within your works limit
Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety
The ideal candidate would have the following attributes;
Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment
Sound experience in asset planning, forecasting and budgeting
Key understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental fundamentals
Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen
What's on offer?
A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. The client is close to public transport and is centrally located in the city fringe area. They offer a flexible work environment and have a magnificent building, you will also be working in a collaborative workspace.

Senior Analyst
Excellent Permanent Position in CBD
Modeling, Forecasting and Analysing Rich Data Sets
Senior Data, Systems and Analytical position
Are you looking for your next permanent position and committed to providing high quality and excellent service through data analysis?
The Company
This Government Agency is accountable for a fundamental service to New Zealand and is full of highly enthusiastic people who want to raise achievement for every New Zealander. This Ministry believes that every New Zealander has the option and chance to be the very best that they can be.
The Team
The team is committed to providing excellent quality work up to a high standard. With the right person leading from the front they will be responsible for using data, systems and analytics to provide the necessary tools to create a strong civil society.
The Role
As a senior in this team you will be providing continuous improvements and enhancements through data, modeling and analytics and building a high performance team. The deliverables are about lifting aspiration and raising achievement for every New Zealander.
Some accountabilities will include:
Undertaking analysis of social, economic, demographic and financial trends relevant to the delivery of local services.
Producing understandable papers and reports showing their analytical findings.
Lead and manage large-scale analytical projects within the policy context of the Ministry.
Maintain good working relationships with key groups, other government agencies and other providers and associations.
Contribute to meetings involving principals and other professionals as required.
Develop analytical frameworks, processes and quantitative models to describe the factors that influence various outcomes and use these to model these factors into the future.
Document all work and ensure appropriate quality review and sign offs are done according to agreed standards.
Provide data, information, guidance and analytical support to relevant internal staff.
Experience
This role needs a capable senior with excellent capabilities in leading teams in a Data and Analytics capacity. Being a part of the continuous development of the team is a major component so great communication skills, patience and a drive to deliver a quality service are important. A strategic thinker who wants to make the role their own, has a drive for career progression and a solid understanding of data and reporting tools and technologies would be preferred.
Contact
For more information please contact Conor Smyth on 04 495 1385 or email through to conor.smyth@randstad.co.nz
At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Who is RUSH?
We are an integrated design + technology studio.
We're a squad of strategic thinkers, empathetic designers and technical mavericks.
We’re united by our love of technology and its potential for making lives better. Some of us are big picture thinkers, some of us creatively driven. And some of us love nothing more than deep diving into a thorny technical challenge. But we’re all human, inspired by human stories and driven by a desire to create human-centred experiences.
We're chasing down the future. We design and engineer exciting new ways to engage with the world's challenges, big or small. Sometimes they're business challenges, sometimes they're about being better humans. But we get the same rush from taking them on.
Love making things for people to enjoy? Join the team designing the technology that matters.
What matters to us?
Put people first - It's about the people, not the tech.
Push the boundaries - Who wants to do what's been done already?
Play the long game - We create sustainable solutions, not quick fixes.
Say it like it is - Life's too short for miscommunication.
Live for the RUSH - Nothing's more exciting than the rush of doing and discovering.
Requirements
Is this for you?
You are someone who is comfortable with getting neck deep in data, while having the ability to zoom out and see the big picture
You are naturally intrigued by what makes people tick and how that manifests in user behaviour
- Good understanding of live testing methods - i.e. A/B testing, cohort analysis
(Preferred) knowledge of query languages (SQL, SumoLogic or similar)

(Preferred) knowledge of data analysis and visualisation software (R, python, Excel)

What will you do?
Define and measure goals, signals and metrics of products in collaboration with Product Managers, Business Analysts, UX Designers and Engineers
Design the data strategy for user engagement and behaviour and how it drives business value to our clients
Design and run quantitative experiments to optimise products based on behavioural data of users
Improve and iterate on the user experience of apps and services by generating and testing hypotheses
Drive change by communicating insights and experiment results with client side stakeholders as well as internal RUSH leadership
Develop statistical models to understand customer behaviours
Benefits
What's The Company Culture Like? What Are The People Like?
Put simply, our office culture is awesome!

It has a start-up buzz, it's youthful, we have lots of social events, we have cake days, fruit days, lunch put-on frequently - put simply, we have a lot of fun together. We also invest in your ongoing training and development with regular goal-setting, group training, lunch and learns and personalised development plans.

We have a very flat structure. You can spark up a conversation with the CEO or anyone in senior management and they'll treat you like family. No staff politics. Not egos, no BS. I promise!
If you've read this far, you're probably interested in the job. If you meet the criteria, want to supercharge your career and work in an environment that cares more about you than your mum does, APPLY FOR THE ROLE - we want to meet you!

Applications are open for a very short time. We'll be making a decision fast so spruce up your CV and send it over - but if you are organised, it will be updated already!

Job_title: Xaxis | Client Engagement Director, New Zealand
Summary:
Overview of job
As the Client Development Director, you will be responsible for evangelizing Xaxis outcomes solutions amongst your peers within agencies, and developing deep relationships to ensure optimal adoption of our outcomes business model. You will collaborate with a group of quick-witted co-workers and clients who are all passionate about digital media. You will engage with our clients in professional and social settings, build relationships and define and implement solutions, that make us indispensable to clients.
Reporting of the role
This role reports to the Group M Managing Director, Digital Services
3 best things about the job:
This is a high profile position with a wealth of opportunity for growth both professionally and personally.
Xaxis is at the forefront of local growth and has grown from 1 person to a team of 9 in just two years. Working within the world’s largest programmatic media company empowers you with the support you need to continue this trajectory.
A fun environment that combines the best of being entrepreneurial whilst at the same time being part of the largest marketing services group in the world
Measures of success –
In three months you will:
Fully understand and be able to communicate the Xaxis value proposition and products
Have built strong relationships with your team members and agency peers
Developed your first outcome proposal for existing clients
Led your first internal Xaxis education session with agency peers
In six months, you will have:
Built and refined your tier 1 client engagement strategy to deliver expected targets set by your Managing Director (short & long term).
to be able to present existing and new Xaxis capabilities to existing / new clients
Identify new opportunities via product offerings to grow incremental revenue with client
Worked with your local and regional support team to develop ongoing client and agency educational initiatives
Responsibilities of the role:
Deliver expected revenue targets defined
Work closely with key stakeholders to assess market demand and establish current and future growth potential.
Build marketing and sales engagement strategies to drive Xaxis revenue.
Ongoing agency and client programmatic and outcomes education
Consult and provide proactive programmatic solutions to agency clients / direct clients
Influence and drive adoption of Xaxis programmatic solutions via workshops, training, brainstorm and pitch sessions with agency.
Conduct market competitive analysis and provide feedback to strengthen Xaxis positioning
Conduct analysis on client need and build new local product offerings to drive incremental revenue
Work closely with Xaxis local and regional team to feedback on key client matters (provide meaningful input) and build proposition for local market.
Work closely with Operations and Supply teams locally to ensure smooth roll out of campaigns.
What you will need:
5 years digital media experience mínimum
An ability to connect digital investrjent with clear business outcomes for clients
Advanced knowledge of the programmatic eco system
Proven digital campaign planning credentials
Agency OR digital sales background to include experience of senior/strategic level interaction with customers
Articulate & strong communicator
Polished presentation skills
Fluent with Excel and Powerpoint skills
Experience in delivering against revenue targets or measureable deliverables
Experience in maintaining senior client relationships and overcoming issues and objections to achieve core business objectives
Logical reasoning skills and comfort with numbers
Experience in managing key clients and maintain long term external client relationships
Experience of multiple industry categories and what drives their online advertising success
Strong understanding of online media market, dynamics and competition.
About Xaxis
Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers and publishers to audiences across all addressable channels. Xaxis combines proprietary technology, unique data assets and exclusive media relationships with the brightest team of audience analysts, data scientists and software engineers. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve higher ROI from digital marketing campaigns. Xaxis works with over 2,700 clients across 34 markets in North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
As a Business Analyst within the Professional Services team your skills will be used across a wide breath of challenging and leading edge projects. Key day to day tasks include:
Establishing and driving requirements
User experience design
Establishing user personas and journeys
Understanding of responsive design and mobile first concepts
Creating documentation i.e. use cases, prototypes, specifications, wireframes, proposals and strategy documents
Championing user experience fundamentals
Participating with the enterprise solutions team in a lead role
Facilitating workshops with stakeholders and internally
About you:
This position will see you utilizing your expertise in the user experience space as the champion for our team. This role will involve analytical business analysis, requirements gathering and influencing decisions within the digital space.
Pivotal for success in this team is your commitment to agile principles and practices, along with a passion for driving the customer experience on technically lead projects. Also key is the ability to communicate with stakeholders to elicit requirements and seek opportunities to improve their business.

Your background:
Business analyst with experience delivering enterprise projects
Excellent documentation and communication skills
Passion for and experience in user experience design is essential
Proven ability to develop hypotheses and shape a project
Keep up to date with the latest digital technologies and design trends
Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments
Good process improvement and change management exposure
Ability to influence stakeholder relationships and drive team performance.
Development background and/or knowledge of the SDLC.
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team that is creating a new enterprise scale software product for the NZ and AU market. Be part of a tight-knit product team in the midst of an incredibly exciting time as we go live with first customers and then take on the challenge of serious scale across NZ, Australia and eventually beyond. All this backed by NZ’s largest privately owned IT firm, Datacom.

Your new role

What you'll need to succeed
