Small business makes the world go round – it’s the heart of the global economy. At Xero we want millions of small businesses to thrive through beautiful software, advice, and connections. We aim to make being a small business more efficient and profitable, and more enjoyable too.
We’re growing rapidly and with growth comes new markets, new partners, new security and risk threats, and new compliance obligations. We are looking for Senior Security Risk Analyst in Auckland who will thrive on the challenge of helping our diverse teams understand and manage their security risks, delivering meaningful security initiatives to keep us ahead of the curve.
You’ll be working as part of a global team across the business to improve Xero’s security risk and compliance posture. Your goal is to help us reduce the risk of security incidents and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Xero’s security controls.
We’re a company founded in New Zealand working on a global scale, as a Xero you’ll take the lead not just on the NZ, ANZ or APAC Security Risk but will be part of our global efforts to build a best in class in-house Security Risk and Compliance practice. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a market leading global SaaS company, working across regions and business units.
At Xero we believe having diverse teams of talented people working together is key to our success, joining us means joining a team of talented professionals across our business working in a fun, innovative, collaborative and high performing environment. Our goal is to enable you to do the best work of your life with Xero.
Some of what you’ll do:
Assess security risks across all areas of Xero’s business, including product, platform, and third party software and services, to ensure these are well understood and managed within Xero’s risk tolerance.
Ensure security compliance obligations, both internally defined and externally regulated, are understood and met across Xero
Maintain the Xero information security management framework. Ensure that security policy and standards keep pace with the changing threat and compliance landscape, and are approved and communicated across Xero.
Develop a threat modelling framework and work with other security teams to roll this out to all product teams.
Develop and maintain an automated risk assessment process for add-on partners and third party providers. Ensure that security risks are assessed and understood prior to, and during the engagement with the third party.
Define requirements and assess solutions to automate and improve the efficiency of risk assessment and reporting processes.
Keep informed as to emerging security threats that have the potential to impact Xero and recommend mitigating strategies.
Provide measurement and reporting of Xero’s risk and compliance position suitable for various levels of Xero’s leadership.
What we’re looking for:
To complement the competencies and skills in the team we are looking for someone with strong knowledge and experience in:
Developing a framework for performing consistent Data Protection (Privacy) Impact Assessments
Performing extensive risk assessments on our whole product suite utilising our security risk management framework
Threat modelling on complex solutions and integrations
Improving risk and compliance processes.
Takes a business focused and pragmatic approach to security risk management
5+ years in a role in an information security and risk management practice
Been recognised as a technical lead or senior contributor in your team
Effectively communicating to a wide range of people
Excellent stakeholder engagement
Working collaboratively and empowering other team members to do their best work
What do we offer?
The opportunity to be part of a growing global success story; a fun, fast-paced work environment and a relaxed, supportive team. A competitive salary, shares in the company and a great office environment.
This is a great opportunity for someone to make the role their own while developing their career in an innovative organization that loves delivering excellence.
If you’d love to work with us send your resume/CV and cover letter using the link below!
If this sounds like the next challenge in your career apply now with your CV & Cover Letter!

Opportunity to champion good security practices
Established kiwi company in the financial sector
Varied and challenging role

What you’ll be doing:

Conduct security risk assessments of network security devices and lead Incident Response
Facilitate audit and vulnerability analysis of networks
Monitor and respond to network security control related incidents
Develop and maintain operational process documents related to the maintenance of network security controls
Review SIEM Management reports. Determine priorities such as patches for applications and servers
Standardize security processes, procedures, and policies when needed
Supports the Threat Vulnerability Assessment (TVA), reporting, management, and remediation of threats
Identify and assess risks to networks, applications, systems, and data
Provide mentorship to the technical team on security initiatives

What you’ll need to succeed:
Experience with threat assessment, vulnerability analysis, risk assessment, information gathering, correlating and reporting
Familiar with Advanced Persistent Threat groups
Experience with phishing attacks
Possess knowledge of PKI, IPS/IDS, DDOS, DLP, NAC, and SIEM
Knowledge of web filtering, malware, anti-spam, firewalls, proxy solutions, and Endpoint protection
Understanding of networking concepts, protocols, standards and controls
CISSP or similar security certs are beneficial
Excellent communication skills: both written and verbal

On behalf of Stride Property, one of New Zealand's leading listed property companies, Cobalt are recruiting for an Investment Manager to join their team here in Auckland.
Stride Property Group (SPG) is an NZX listed stapled group comprising Stride Property Limited (Stride) and Stride Investment Management Limited (SIML).
They are primarily investors in New Zealand office, retail and industrial property. SIML is a specialist real estate investment manager.
The investment manager has a key position within the investment management team responsible for the performance of a portfolio of properties managed by SIML.
In your new position you will work with investment, development and asset teams across the company including executive management and Board Directors, with key tasks including but not limited to:
Work closely with investment analysts to assess financial and commercial information relating to investment opportunities, including provision of valuations to support acquisition and disposals.
Presents investment opportunities and supporting analysis to develop an investment case and recommendation for the executive.
Manages the uses of complex financial models to; provide timely, accurate and efficient fund business plans, forecasts, modelling and other analytics to facilitate clear business decision-making and investor reporting.
Engages in regular research and reading to stay apprised about the state of the NZ economy, global financial markets, general current events and research across core and adjacent property sectors to inform strategy and business decision making.
Maintains current knowledge of the debt and equity capital markets, including interest rates, as they relate to SIML managed funds and makes strategy recommendations to the executive.
Maintains and develops relationships with, investment banks, domestic banks, other debt providers, valuers and commercial real estate agents, research analysts and research providers, investors, providers of investment capital and other key stakeholder to stay informed of market activity and originate transactions.
To be successful in this role you should be able to demonstrate the following:
A NZ recognised tertiary degree in Property or Finance (e.g. Economics, Property, Valuations, Finance, Commerce/Business)
5+ years prior experience within the Property sector (e.g. Commercial Valuations, Property/Development Analysts)
Possess a high financial aptitude, commercial acumen and ability to analyse financial data from budgets, business plans and valuations
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the capacity to produce high-quality reports, analysis and presentations under tight deadlines
Strong numerical reasoning and well-developed financial modelling skills with an understanding and working knowledge of asset management software
Relationship management experience, and a customer/client focus
A high level of flexibility and the ability to work hard in a demanding environment
Career enhancing opportunities with an employer of this calibre don't frequent the market very often. If you are looking for senior position with a highly active investor in the property market this is a fantastic opportunity to achieve that objective.
If you're interested to learn more about this opportunity please submit your interest via the link above, or alternatively for a confidential conversation contact Matt Webster at Cobalt Recruitment on (09) 303 9093

A Little Bit About The Company

This is an entrepreneurial business with offices located conveniently in Mt Wellington. The team structure is flat, small and teeming with like-minded, high performing individuals with a love for adding value.

Due to growth and exciting plans, this role provides an exceptional opportunity for someone who is looking to make use of their SQL abilities - contributing to creating meaningful displays of data, analyze trends and provide commentary for overall decision making.

It is a smaller team but of extremely high calibre - most of them being Qualified Accountants. This will give you a broad role with a close and supportive team around you.

Some More Information About The Role

The role is office-based, working alongside the Finance Manager in a sales orientated environment. Overall duties include:
Assist in the day to day preparation of financial reports
Analysis and commentary of financial results
Financial modeling for business development scenarios/new products
Giving insights to trends, issues and opportunities
Maintain product dashboard reporting
Monthly forecast and annual budgeting work
Create and help automate data exporting for information sharing
Data manipulation language, SQL commands

So, Who Are You And What Is Your Profile?

You will have a strong analytical and reporting background looking to take on a new challenge. Experience in a finance analyst or management accounting role in a New Zealand environment for a multinational or corporate will be advantageous.

You will have experience in writing and modifying SQL script and be strong with Excel. You will also have strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail and the ability to develop relationships. You will have the ability to take ownership and show strong leadership skills. Excellent communication is a must.

For further details contact Jonelle on 09 410 7235 or apply directly.

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring

Closes 08 Mar 2020
Posted 18 Feb 2020
Where you'll be working: Hamilton
The details: Permanent, 40 hours per week
This is an opportunity for a vibrant, enthusiastic, and experienced Test Analyst to join our Hamilton based DevOps team. We are a major organisation with a high volume of critical, complex and challenging projects underway and an exciting pipeline of activity in the making.
We have a busy test team and are looking to grow our delivery capability with a focus on lifting our automated testing capability.
You will hold ISTQB Foundation certification, are robust in your processes and passionate about Testing. You thrive as part of a team while happily working with a degree of autonomy. Focusing on customer outcomes and relationship management are second nature. You will bring your experience in an automated testing environment.
The role will deliver Test service improvement initiatives to the delivery and performance of all testing services, through the adoption of TaaS (Test as a Service) and management of the service delivery life cycle and desired state approach.
The role will be involved in the entire testing effort from planning and execution through to UAT and will deliver effective test suites and regimes for in-house product development, software application development, information system launches, and operations systems enhancements.
This individual will apply proven analytical and problem-solving skills to help validate, verify, communicate, and resolve systems/software application issues through careful testing in order to maximize the benefit of IT investments and initiatives. Effective development of plans and coordination of team resources is essential in the successful management and delivery of testing services to our customer base.
Desirable Qualifications and Experience:
Relevant formal qualification in Business / Computer Science / Information Systems or equivalent relevant work experience.
ISTQB Fundamental certification is mandatory, while advanced ISTQB certification (Agile Tester/Technical Test Analyst) is desired
DevOps experience, ITIL certified or equivalent exposure to ITIL practices.
2-3 years hands-on testing experience with programming languages like Java, C# etc.
Minimum of 3 years hands on experience with development of a Test Automation framework from scratch - Data Driven, Keyword Driven, Hybrid model, Page object Model etc.
Pro-active starter and with at least 2+ years hands on experience with Automation & Performance Tools - Unified Functional Tool (UFT), Selenium, JMeter, SoapUI, Postman etc.
Experience in health care industry would be preferred
Experience with test effort estimation, requirements analysis and test tools evaluation
At least 5 years' experience working within an IS organisation using Microsoft technologies
Experience with running SQL queries and database testing
Experience with Test Management Tools, preferably HP-Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)
Experience mentoring juniors on Automation Test set-up, design and execution.
Experience with Share point, Project Server & Microsoft Office Tools.

Join a leading telecommunications company as a Commissions Financial Analyst!
We are looking for a Commissions Lead Financial Analyst who will be accountable for ensuring the commission scheme design delivers the necessary sales results to ensure accurate and timely payments, tight governance controls and providing insightful and meaningful reporting and analytics.

What will I be doing?
Fully understand the Commission scheme designs and provide guidance to changes requested, explain potential impacts and set expectations.
Manage the end to end calculation process to ensure accurate and timely payment of sales commissions in compliance with Sales Commissions schemes, business goals and PES.
Analyse data inputs necessary to perform calculations ensuring all controls and reconciliations have been completed.
Design and develop process improvements and automation wherever possible for robust and consistent calculations.
Establish clear and simple reporting with analysis and insight to facilitate the approvals to be gained from management and to communicate final payments to sales professionals.
Utilise in-depth understanding of Commissions scheme concepts and principles to resolve any queries or exceptions raised by management. Own the root cause analysis on queries raised and propose necessary improvements to prevent reoccurrence where possible.
Drive the governance process for decision making, dispute resolution and scheme change requests. Input into monthly board meeting (COB) with appropriate Sales management and make recommendations, presenting necessary analysis, cost modelling or other data to support decision making.

What will I bring?
You must have a strong Financial Analyst background, and have some experience in a commissions environment is desired.
You will be an absolute excel whizz, where complex modelling and formulas are second nature, as is speed and accuracy.
As a natural problem solver with good analytical and decision making skills, you must be able to clearly articulate your findings in a concise and engaging manner.
You will have impeccable communication skills, with the ability to liaise with a variety of different stakeholders across the business, and be confident and comfortable in delivering complex data in a clear and concise manner.
You will have an abundance of energy and will feel at ease working in an incredibly fast paced, ever changing agile environment.
It is essential that you have excellent time management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, meet tight deadlines and work well under pressure

This is a full time contract position, starting ASAP through until 14th October 2019 and is located in modern state of the art offices in Takapuna.

Your new company

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

About the role
The mission of the Data & Analytics technology team is to deliver quality, reusable data for our business. This role is working part of a team that focuses on improving the way we deliver via automation, performance enhancements, CI/CD and more.
As a Developer within the ANZ Data & Analytics team you will work collaboratively with high-performing Agile teams.
You will undertake analysis, and be involved in design and specification of system changes.
An integral part of this role will be to identify improvement opportunities, code, test and implement enhancements and fixes, and provide operational support.
Be involved in the continuous improvements of both the platform (processes and systems) and the team’s ways of working (DevOps/Agile).
Role Location: Wellington CBD
Role Type: Permanent

About you
You will have a wide breath of interests and experience, from databases to applications.
You will be an enthusiastic learner who questions the status quo and enjoys problem solving.
You will be a communicator, and enjoy spending your day working alongside other developers, testers, business analysts, and product owners.
You will have the ability to communicate complex technical issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.
You will enjoy working in small teams where collaboration and relationship building is key. We are interested in people who enjoy a dynamic, rapidly changing environment, who don’t get attached to a particular technology or practice and importantly who want to drive change in the organisation.
You will be passionate about writing modular, well tested, code that follows good software development principles.
You will have proven experience working as a Developer in agile environments, and be excited by the opportunity to contribute to the ongoing improvement of development processes, tools, strategy, and methodology.
Essential Skills & Experience:
Database and/or application experience
Strong interest and understanding of DevOps including Openshift, CI/CD, Automation, optimisation of environments
Solid understanding of good software engineering principles and practices for keeping a codebase of high maintainability.
Experience with automated testing
Experience with scrum or other Agile practices.
A rigorous and logical approach to problem solving, clear communication skills and excellent time management.


Some of our other benefits include:
Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
Southern Cross Health Insurance

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

Our Purpose
Datacom connects people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
This is an excellent opportunity not to be missed! You will be joining a fantastic leadership team in our extensive Service Operations business who provides services across multiple locations across Australia and New Zealand. It is a chance to make your mark in an evolving business with strong people and customer focus. This role is located in Wellington and is ideal for someone who is experienced in leading a Configuration Management team and is keen to develop a high performing team with loads of variety and opportunity.
About the Role
This exciting leadership role in the Operate business will be responsible for the Service Asset and Configuration Management (SACM) Services provided by their team members across multiple locations across Australian and New Zealand. This role ensures we deliver value to our customers and internal stakeholders through the delivery of high-quality SACM services, with the goal of delivering an accurate CMDB for Datacom customers.
As the ANZ Service Lead for Service Configuration Management you will be responsible for;

1. Ensuring the ANZ team of Service Configuration Managers and Analysts deliver high quality services to Datacom customers.
2. SACM Process Delivery Ownership across ANZ – managing CMDB accuracy, Process governance and Service Level Agreement (SLA) commitments.
3. Leading all SACM Process Improvements including automation initiatives.
4. Managing all customer contractual commitments are met whilst maintaining a high level of customer service satisfaction.
The ANZ Service Lead will be the escalation for all Configuration Management Operations across Australian and New Zealand. Being a key role in our team, you’ll champion CMDB accuracy efficiencies and Service Mapping within Datacom’s ITSM toolset.
What you’ll do
In this role you will work collaboratively with all Service Operations Leads, Software Delivery Executives and Customer Account Management. Essentially, the ANZ Service Lead:
Act as SACM Subject Matter Expert (SME) lead for the delivery on the customer account/s.
Ensure effective and smooth delivery of our customer’s Service configuration management operations.
Manage escalations for customers.
Oversee all outcomes of the customer configuration management contracts.
Lead the Service Configuration Management Operational Processes.
Manage the Service Level Agreements (SLA) for all SACM services.
Work collaboratively with a larger Service Operations leadership team who will support in delivering Datacom Managed Services as well as autonomously within your service line.
Review current SLAs to ensure that the account is not exposed to any breaches or risks.
What you’ll bring
We’re looking for a proactive, independent, enthusiastic team member who’s interested in being part of a larger leadership group delivering a high quality and efficient service to our customers.
You’ll bring expertise developed over 5+ years in a similar management role, as you will be viewed as the Service Configuration Management Operations primary contact for customer accounts.
You must have experience in managing a team and have client facing experience.
Your ability to work with other members of the Service Operations Management team to develop and deliver quality solutions for our customer is critical to the success of our model.

You must be a NZ citizen or Permanent Resident to be eligible for this role.

About Movio
Movio’s purpose is to connect moviegoers to their ideal movie. We achieve this by being the global leader in marketing data analytics and campaign management for the world’s cinema exhibitors, studios and distributors.
Love technology, love movies? This is your chance to work with some of the world’s largest cinemas!
About the role
This isn’t your typical support role working off tickets all day. You’ll be responsible for the end-to-end resolution of issues, ranging from basic to complex technical problems, accountable for new client implementations and providing Level 2-3 technical support for our clients.
You’ll develop trusting relationships with clients across the APAC region, building solutions and providing techncial guidance. You'll be part of a global support team. There is no hierarchy in this team, you’ll all roll up your sleeves to get the job done.
Maybe you’ve come from a data analyst, data engineer, application support or software support background and looking for a more diverse and more collaborative role.
Regardless you’ll:
Love learning - Our Support team is fuelled by peer-to-peer learning, collaboration and extensive knowledge sharing
Be fearless in tackling problems that are outside of your comfort zone. We rely on your inquisitive mind to dig around the product to find out what’s going on
Be a big picture thinker - This role is not just about solving issues raised by our clients - We want to highlight recurring patterns and trends
Take pride in your work - At Movio we don’t cut corners. You will understand that every interaction with our clients should help to build their trust in Movio’s ability to deliver top-of-class products and services
Love engaging with a wide variety of people - This role often requires conversations between our Engineering team, Regional teams and clients to solve a problem
Requirements
Tech skills / Experience required:
A strong working knowledge with SQL
2 + years’ experience in a technical support capacity for a SaaS product company, or software-driven environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong client relationship skills
Great problem solving and analytical skills
A natural curiosity about how things work
Ability to translate technical situations into easy to understand explanations for everyone


Movio is part of Vista Group International Ltd (NZX & ASX: VGL), a world-leading enterprise comprised of eight businesses that provide software, digital and online solutions to the film industry, we're in great company. But we're often on the look-out for new brains and faces to join us along the way. If film, data, and technology seem like the perfect fit, it's time to apply.

Here at Movio we value inclusivity and celebrate diversity. We’re committed to offering equal opportunity to our staff and candidates — regardless of gender, age, race, ethnicity, marital status, disability, sex, sexual orientation, religious, ethical beliefs or political opinion. This commitment is reflected in all our employment policies and procedures.

Serko is a leading hi-tech company providing corporate travel software and expense management solutions. We now have upwards of 200 employees in 5 countries with our US team based in Minneapolis. We're still small enough for everyone to know everyone but we're big enough to take on the big boys and win. And that's the plan. Due to this ongoing success and growing customer base we now have an opportunity for a Principal Services Analyst to join our Global Client Services Team in Auckland, New Zealand.

Reporting directly to our Head of Global Support in Auckland, this position will be responsible for helping to foster a culture of continuous improvement in the Serko Global Support space.
Role Overview
You will play a key role in the Serko team by:
Helping implement a sustained culture of continuous improvement in how Global Support operates
Implementing improved data capture and providing useful insight from analysing this data.
Preparing high quality reporting and documentation for Serko Senior Management and our clients.
Cultivating relationships with our key clients through regular health check meetings and other regular interactions.
Requirements
You….
Get a kick out of making things work better, deftly identifying process gaps and improving processes.
Thrive to help others do their work better and with greater autonomy, while enabling them to have more fun doing it.
Love data - collecting it, analysing it, and using it to make things better. You’re a master in Excel, and ideally good with PowerBI also.
Are an expert in crafting business documentation, both internal and client-facing.
Go out of your way to improve customer experience. You understand the difference between good customer service and superior customer service.
Love experimenting – identifying potential gaps, proposing ways in which they can be bettered, trying them out and acting upon the outcome. And not being afraid to fail!
Have a demonstrable desire for personal growth, for autonomy and for continuous learning.
Like the challenge of sometimes working outside of your comfort zone; that thing you’re going to be doing for the first time makes you excited!
Have a proven ability to keep calm under pressure
You’re likely also…
A talented people person. You’ll have no direct reports, but you’ll need to know how to work adeptly with people at all levels of the organisation as well as with some VIPs within our client base.
Benefits
Serko's people are rewarded for their efforts with a great salary and competitive benefits. If you’re up for a challenge, and are excited about joining a business with a growing international reputation, we’d love to hear from you.
To find out more about working at Serko go to http://www.serko.com/about-serko/

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
If you’re looking for career development opportunities, working on exciting projects and being part of a tight knit group of relaxed, happy people, then we’re it. We are looking for someone who is prepared to learn and participate in a fun, close-knit and supportive team, with a manager who focuses on trust, partnership, and work life balance as core values. If you have minimum of 6 years’ experience in software development and have excellent communication skills, we’re looking for you!
You’ll have plenty of real opportunities to widen your professional skills. We pride ourselves on providing our staff numerous career opportunities during their time with us; our adaptability relies on this. Along with career development we also provide you with life, health, and income protection insurances.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The role sits within Datacom’s Gateways team and we are seeking a motivated analyst programmer/software developer who is looking to make their mark in the industry. The Gateways team works in the payments and messaging space and is responsible for delivering those products and services to platform, channel and individual customers in multiple markets.
What you’ll do
§ Problem solving & Learning – given the scope of the product we are enhancing, the key ingredient you’ll have is a willingness to learn, problem solve, and try new things.
§ Journey & Ownership – having the chance to be part of creating something new and awesome, taking it to pilot and then beyond into full production. This is a role to commit to and to grow with.
§ Customer Focus - a real passion for great customer outcomes and successes, going the extra mile to make sure the experience for the customer is as good as it can be.
§ Design – an eye for design with strong UI skills and experience to help create simple, clean, intuitive interfaces
§ Domain Knowledge – building a strong understanding of the customer domain and working closely with customers to innovate and improve their business.
What you’ll bring
While experience in the payments space is beneficial one of the main attributes we’re looking for is someone who has passion for what they do, along with a ‘can do’ approach and team-oriented attitude. In other words, you may have domain knowledge and technical prowess but personality fit plays a big part.
§ A software focussed tertiary qualification
§ Minimum of 5 years C++, C#, ASP.net, JavaScript, JQuery. 2+ years developer experience as a Mobile programmer in areas such as App/Software Design, Coding (including Native App development) and reasonable knowledge of UX and UI would be a plus.
§ Experience with enterprise system development is preferred particularly
experience in systems design, programming and/or systems software ideally in a product development environment
hands on experience with Test Drive Development techniques, implementing and configuring Automated Build, Test and Deploys is preferred
§ A working knowledge of and experience in the following areas is desirable
Windows .NET Framework, including ASP.Net programming experience, Database design/administration experience (Design, implementation, modification, is required.
Proficiency in writing fine-tuned SQL queries, stored procedures (eg. PL/SQL code) and working with data in relational databases like Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL is required.
Ability to Recognize and resolve system related problems; work independently and make necessary decisions throughout the systems process within department guidelines.

Job_title: Management / Cost Accountant - Global Packaging Company
Summary:
Global Packaging Business
Engaging role to provide process improvements & efficiencies
About Our Client
Our client is one of the world's leading Consumer Packaging Companies, employing 16,000 employees in 35 countries. Their Henderson based site employs just over 200 staff, and manufactures a variety of Food Service and rigid plastic food packaging solutions to leading food companies.
They are seeking a strong Management/Cost Accountant to join them in a temp/contract capacity for 3-6 months.
Job Description
Responsibilities will include:
Ensuring product costing is in line with financial standards
Complete all traded product costings
Work to ensure accurate costings on manufactured items
Analysis of job cost variances, as well as identification and follow up on corrective actions to reduce those variances.
Monthly inventory reconciliation and variance account analysis
Providing financial input into the preparation of sales price quotes and help the team understand it
Ensure accuracy and maintenance of the Business Unit's costing systems.
Support the business by providing information and analysis to enhance decision making with respect to profitability.
Provide analysis and support to the annual budgeting process.
Provide information and analysis to support production decision making.
Completes root cause analysis for identified business issues
The Successful Applicant
You will ideally have the following:
Tertiary qualified in finance/accounting
Previous business/financial analyst experience ideally in a manufacturing environment.
Solid experience with product costing and analysis in a manufacturing environment
Good understanding of item master data in a big ERP system (JDE/Epicor/Oracle/SAP).
A hands on approach with a strong focus on continuous improvement
The confidence and the ability to develop and implement strategies to influence and impact people at all levels in an organisation.
What's on Offer
A rewarding role where you will be responsible for partnering heavily with the business to improve processes and efficiencies. Highly rewarding remuneration

Job_title: Corporate Account Manager, Google Cloud Platform
Summary:
Individuals applying for this position will not be eligible for immigration sponsorship.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in direct client sales/management.

Preferred qualifications:
Customer and relationship management experience with technology-using platforms or in the area of Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS).
Demonstrated ability to engage with developer audiences as well as C-level IT and business leaders.
Ability to work towards strategic business goals in a fast-paced environment.
About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
As a Corporate Account Manager, you'll advocate for the Cloud Platform, promoting technology for business innovation. You'll introduce Google Cloud Platform to our customers and accounts, drive awareness in the developer and startup community, and leverage and build the Google Cloud Platform partner ecosystem.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Engage with prospect organizations to effectively position Google Cloud Platform solutions using strategic value-based solution proposals, references and analyst data.
Work with the wider Google Ads and Google Cloud Account teams to develop and drive pipeline, and to provide guidance. Work with Google Cloud Platform partners to develop campaigns.
Serve as the primary customer contact during bid submission, pilot test, legal review and procurement. Keep records of customer interactions and provide quarterly projections.
Leverage Google Sales Engineering and Marketing resources, and provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

With over 6,500 people, and annual revenues of over $1.2 billion, Datacom is one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. Datacom has extensive expertise in the delivery of professional services, software engineering, application management, and the operation of data centres, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. Founded in 1965 and, operating across a number of regions, Datacom has a successful trading history of consistent growth and profitability from a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective digital and technology solutions. Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting diverse talent. Our people are the best in their fields - smart, passionate, and dedicated to providing exceptional IT services to our customers. This makes for a rewarding and fast-paced work environment.

About the role:
We’re looking for an experienced Pega Lead Systems Architect, with strong solution, architectural and technical foundation to assist our team in delivering key implementation projects into some of Australasia’s industry leading businesses and to assist in the evolution of our Pega practice.
In this role you will be involved in the Design, Build and Delivery of solutions using Pega PRPC for some of our businesses Premier customers.
Click on the link below for more information!
https://youtu.be/DwhtUSILxfI

About you:
As such we are looking for an individual who can demonstrate a strong sense of ownership, a passion for delivering quality solutions and a résumé that demonstrates expertise in successful delivery.
The successful candidate will be self-motivated, with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities. You will also be well versed in communicating clearly to peers, business analysts and with our customer’s subject matter experts and decision makers.

Desired Skills and Experience:
A minimum of 5 years of Pega experience is required.
Certified Lead System Architect with demonstrable experience in this role
Possess detailed understanding of the Pega Platform Architecture, Tools and Frameworks.
Should Lead Inception and Design workshops through DCO and other Pega tools.
Ability to lead the Business Requirements Gathering, Design Solutions and to Derive Estimates for Pega Implementations.
Should be able to Propose Solutions in Pega to fit the users requirements along with Enterprise Reuse and Framework Implementations.
Ability to identify the Risks and Dependencies for the solution during Project Execution.
Should have excellent Technical skills in Pega Case Management, Decisioning and Integration capabilities.
Experience in delivering at least two End to End project implementations using the Pega7 Platform with in depth knowledge and involvement in the solution design and process.
Ability to understand the external applications and Integration Components (RDBMS, REST, SOAP, etc) and implement solutions.
Recommend reusable components and process improvement options with in the SDLC.
Ability to handle Non-Functional Requirements and provide suitable solutions for Performance, Integrations, Security Requirements etc.
Ability to lead the team and to effectively share knowledge and expertise with team members.
Excellent verbal and written English with confidence and experience in presenting to business SMEs and stake holders.
Ability to foster collaborative partnerships with key stakeholders and user groups.
Provides assistance and advice to business users in the effective use of applications.

Banking Domain Knowledge.
Government Domain Knowledge.

Do you love building compelling customer experiences?
Ponsonby location | Inspiring leader | Energetic, fun, friendly team

This organisation has an eye to digital learning and is going through an exciting time of change where they are in the process of expanding their offerings beyond the borders of NZ.

About the role

In this role you will be responsible for driving digital acquisition performance across paid and organic search channels, digital display networks and paid social media for a portfolio of brands.

You will work cross-functionally with key internal and external stakeholders to develop and deliver digital initiatives that ensure profitable, sustainable customer growth by driving lower cost per acquisition and optimal sales conversion rates.

You will own:
Developing and delivering timely digital acquisition media plans including managing budgets
Understanding the customer journey and improving on-page experiences to drive positive brand sentiment, relevant comms and high conversion rates
Organic search engine optimisation and paid search optimisation
Actively monitoring and reviewing campaign performance against agreed targets and costs, recording and reporting performance and changes
Making data-led decisions and ensuring that measurement and analytic tools are reviewed and refined constantly to make the best decisions – balancing business and customer outcomes
Improving paid performance across all channels – actively lowering the cost of acquisition
You will be supported by:
The Product/customer and creative teams who will ensure you have the content and insights you need to deliver on an exceptional digital customer experience
Marketing Operation Specialist – who will provide support with site updates and other tasks
A data-driven agency with performance analyst support
About you:

You’ll be a data-driven marketer with a flair for copywriting, campaign management and an understanding of conversion optimisation. You have knowledge of google analytics and SEO, and you’ll love building compelling customer experiences.

Our purpose:
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team:
The Application Management team is part of our Professional Services Software group and a group of product squads. This is a widely diverse team of digital professionals who recognise that businesses maintain a competitive edge through their applications. Keeping this advantage takes business agility and continuous innovation. The team prides themselves on the optimal management and improvement of business as usual operations, and the flawless integration of innovation over the application lifecycle.
It is a lean operation using the latest development tools, technologies and agile practices that allow our clients to keep ahead of the game.

The Nitty Gritty:
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role :
You’ll find a refreshing variety of work here; we do everything from boutique websites, through to large bespoke jobs. We have teams who specialise in every area of tech, so you can learn from the best. You’ll also find that you are involved in the full SDLC, from presales and RFP stage through to delivery.
Capabilities we are looking for in addition to being a senior developer;
Provide technical leadership, leading a team, delegating and reviewing work
Ability to design and implement a complete solution to complex problems, including, design, initial setup.
DevOps and agile experience conversant with multiple cloud platforms and associated DevOps toolsets
Able to implement complex features and unit tests and fix complex bugs.
Ability to lead more junior developers and provide guidance on best practices, design patterns
Prepare clear and concise written communication including formal specifications and documentation, letters and emails, contracts and proposals and wiki-based project and support documentation
Deal directly with stakeholders internally and from our customers at all levels
What you’ll do :
We are looking to build New Zealand’s leading services team and need someone that shares the same vision. Customer obsession, along with focused delivery capability are a must, combined with ambitious aspirations to run it all. The tech lead will be responsible for leading the technical direction across specific customer engagements, mentoring developers and analysts, and engaging with customers as required.
You are thoroughly versed in Service Management or Support in a large-scale and diverse environment of incident management, escalation procedures and related disciplines. Previous experience as a Team Lead or demonstrable experience in leading virtual / geographically dispersed teams is also beneficial, as well as managing 3rd parties and 3rd party delivered services.

What you’ll bring :
6+ years’ experience working on IT projects across multiple phases of the SDLC.
Team player, who enjoys working collaboratively.
Must be able to anticipate and proactively handle issues.
Must be excellent at personal task management and follow through.
Expert level knowledge and hands-on experience with Microsoft stack technologies
Strong knowledge of .Net or .Net Core, experience creating and consuming web services and web applications.
Experience with Azure cloud platform or comparable public cloud platform.
Experience with web front-end technologies including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, React, Angular, or ASP .Net Razor.
Experience with desktop and middleware applications will be an advantage.

About Us

We are a market leading commercial fuel card and payment solutions provider, operating in 53 countries and employing more than 7000 people globally. In New Zealand, wholly-owned FLEETCOR subsidiary CardLink Ltd operates CardSmart, New Zealand’s leading multi-branded fuel cards.
FLEETCOR is ranked 26th on Forbes 2018 World's Most Innovative Companies and 107th on Forbes 2018 Growth Champions.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a global forerunner in payment solutions and be part of a fast growing global business.
About The Role
We’re on the market for an experienced Salesforce platform lead to maintain, configure and optimize Salesforce, creating efficiencies, implementing strategic road maps and driving business transformation.

Key responsibilities include:
Designing, building, configuring and maintaining application modules, reports, processes and campaigns
Identifying business requirements
Providing integrated process and system solutions
Optimizing Salesforce via data, process and system integration activities - e.g. configuration, data translation and transformation, data quality audits, enhanced workflows and user experience.
Providing front line user support
Collaborating with architecture and operations teams to ensure technical aspects of solutions are aligned with customer needs and business strategy
Ensuring quality of practice meets contractual requirements, legal obligations in accordance to Fleetcor's policy and procedures
Developing a full understanding of internal and external customer needs
Evaluating opportunities to address unmet requirements
Supporting the business and technical interface between assigned business
Working cross functionally within the business to achieve improvements
About You

This position would suit an experienced Salesforce consultant, business analyst or project lead who understands how to manage the end to end process of design, development and delivery of Salesforce cross functionally across departments whilst achieving key business objectives tied to the overall customer life cycle.
To be considered for this position you will have:
Minimum 5 years in the workforce with a broad range of experience in business analysis and improvement, process and functional solution design and implementation.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in Salesforce administration and configuration
Salesforce certification is a bonus.
Strength in wide-scale process mapping and re-engineering as well as experience in functional design solutions.
Excellent communication skills and attention to detail
Ability to problem solve and take initiative to identify, evaluate and translate data into appropriate outcomes
Additionally, you will be able to think through problems and make actionable recommendations.
Project management and exposure to the fuel, oil, or banking sector is a bonus
What you get in return
Apart from plenty of opportunities to grow and make an impact, working at FLEETCOR also has many benefits such as:
Competitive Salary
Work Anniversary Day Off
Gym Membership
Fuel Discounts
Complimentary Life insurance
Modern, central office space near public transport
Dedicated team of specialists with a people focused culture

Immediate start - 6 month contract
Renowned NZ clothing brand
About Our Client
This company is a highly desirable employer - an iconic kiwi clothing brand looking for someone to start ASAP in their finance team. Working in the retail industry you can expect high volumes, fast pace, variety in processing and you'll need to be able to think on your feet! This is a seriously cool company - established over 100 years ago, they create clothing for trusted sports teams and every day Kiwi's.
Job Description
This role is responsible for establishing effective performance reporting, and an efficient and accurate flow of financial data and commentary throughout the business. To provide timely, accurate and insightful data and analysis, with a focus on driving the business forward from a commercial viewpoint, enabling strategic planning and decision making.
Responsibilities will include:
Comprehensive understanding of actual and forecast sales & margin performance, with tracking of risks and opportunities.
Establish performance analysis, forecast models & reporting on all areas of business performance both financially and commercially that assist the business in delivery of targets and decision making.
Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

Partnering with commercial and product leads to build and validate commercial plans built by channel, customer and product group - instilling a process of cyclical review and reforecasting - and coordinating sales & margin input for annual budgets and rolling forecasts.
Assist with preparation of annual budget/forecast building for all sales, margin and royalty numbers
Leading the inventory review process - ensuring early identification of, and actions to clear, slow moving stock lines.
Collation & distribution of daily, weekly and monthly sales, margin & stock reporting
Improving the provision, accessibility and consistency of sales and margin data - driving automation and 'self-service' where practical.
Providing product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range.
Establish range KPIs for ANZ. Provide product teams with historic and forecast product and margin performance and parameters to inform range build - including target sales, margin and SCO productivity by range. Provide insight as to opportunities to better drive sales and/or profit. Development of analysis pack to support proposition and range sell-in proposals.
Recommend how to regularly report on channel profitability and cost to serve. Provide recommendations and insight as to how to improve channel/asset profitability.
The Successful Applicant
A Degree level or equivalent education in relevant field (accounting or finance)
Proven analytical skills backed up by a high level of commercial acumen and financial understanding
Ability to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders to engage and influence
Experience of working within tight deadlines and ability to multitask.
The ability to interpret large quantities of data and identify and communicate pertinent points, utilising independent thinking, judgement and visual modelling to further the value of analysis.
Recognition of revenue & cost drivers & the business cycle
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel.
What's on Offer
The opportunity to work for an iconic Kiwi brand with a great company culture and environment.

About the role;
The Planning Manager is responsible for the data management and the asset planning integrity on this major portfolio of properties. This role is predominately office based and most of your time will be spent planning, forecasting and setting the budgets for the following year. In this position your main responsibilities will be, but not limited to:
Develop and manage the annual and long-term Asset Management plans
Maintaining the ongoing maintenance and upgrades of a single asset management system
Be the escalation point for the outsourced Facilities Managers
The planning, forecasting and budgeting for single capital works programme
Reviewing quotes and raising purchase orders within your works limit
Engaging with internal stakeholders
Ensuring that all assets meet government regulations and industry standards
Be accountable for financial forecasting and budgeting of operational expenditure
Promoting a Zero Harm and collaborative approach to Health & Safety

Stable working history with proven experience in asset planning gained working in a commercial or industrial environment

Relationship rapport building abilities with excellent communication skills
SAP or similar, and Microsoft Office Suite and a FM suite capability to an intermediate level
Experience reviewing works quotes and raising purchase orders
Outstanding ability to work in a collaborative, diverse, flexible and autonomous role
Must hold NZ PR or be a NZ Citizen

A competitive package is on offer. You will be offered the opportunity to engage in continuous learning and upskilling. Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.

Our team
Our Wellington Service Desk boasts over 150 team members dedicated to solving technical issues for more than 20 large client environments. Located on the Jervois Quay waterfront, we have a great team culture with a strong focus on being professional, efficient and easy to work with.

The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

About the Role
As a Service Desk Analyst, you’ll be the first point of contact for our biggest clients. No two days will be the same as you’ll be constantly thinking outside of the box to troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the most efficient and effective customer service, possible! You’ll be supported and mentored by our team and have constant opportunities to grow your skills. If you’re looking for somewhere to develop your career within a great culture, then this is the role for you!

What you’ll bring
Although work experience is great, we value a can-do attitude and passion much more! Your verbal and written communication skills are key to your success in this role. Ideally, you’ll have customer service experience, as its most important to us that you can keep our customers happy with your effective communication skills. We’re looking for team members of all levels, so if you have experience within a Service Desk or an Enterprise IT support environment, this is a bonus! Or perhaps you are supporting a smaller environment and you're looking for the opportunity to grow within a large organisation.
We will review applications as they come through, and you can expect contact from us within a couple of weeks. Only candidates with work rights in New Zealand will be considered.

If this sounds like the opportunity you’re looking for, please apply online now!

Please note: This information is not to be re-distributed without permission from Datacom and NxtStep (AttractHQ Ltd)

About the role
The mission of the Data & Analytics technology team is to deliver quality, reusable data for our business. This role is working part of a team that focuses on improving the way we deliver via automation, performance enhancements, CI/CD and more.
As a Developer within the ANZ Data & Analytics team you will work collaboratively with high-performing Agile teams.
You will undertake analysis, and be involved in design and specification of system changes.
An integral part of this role will be to identify improvement opportunities, code, test and implement enhancements and fixes, and provide operational support.
Be involved in the continuous improvements of both the platform (processes and systems) and the team’s ways of working (DevOps/Agile).
Role Location: Wellington CBD
Role Type: Permanent

About you
You will have a wide breath of interests and experience, from databases to applications.
You will be an enthusiastic learner who questions the status quo and enjoys problem solving.
You will be a communicator, and enjoy spending your day working alongside other developers, testers, business analysts, and product owners.
You will have the ability to communicate complex technical issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.
You will enjoy working in small teams where collaboration and relationship building is key. We are interested in people who enjoy a dynamic, rapidly changing environment, who don’t get attached to a particular technology or practice and importantly who want to drive change in the organisation.
You will be passionate about writing modular, well tested, code that follows good software development principles.
You will have proven experience working as a Developer in agile environments, and be excited by the opportunity to contribute to the ongoing improvement of development processes, tools, strategy, and methodology.

Database and/or application experience
Strong interest and understanding of DevOps including Openshift, CI/CD, Automation, optimisation of environments
Solid understanding of good software engineering principles and practices for keeping a codebase of high maintainability.
Experience with automated testing
Experience with scrum or other Agile practices.
A rigorous and logical approach to problem solving, clear communication skills and excellent time management.

Mentor and Lead a team providing SAS and SSIS guidance and advice.
Contribute to the development of CFW’s technology roadmap.
Identify process improvement and MIS reporting value add opportunities.
About The Role:
The Customer Financial Wellbeing (CFW) Team within ANZ operates as a customer focused unit that manages those customers who have, for various reasons, entered into a high risk financial situation and require specialist financial management. In this role, you will lead the development and distribution of MIS reporting and analysis to support CFW to meet operational deliverables and efficiencies, initiatives and strategy. You will also work closely with the CFW Systems Enablement Managers to contribute to the development and delivery of the technology roadmap, including on-going support of key systems and identification of process improvement opportunities and/or seeing where MIS can add value in the CFW team. In this position you will have the opportunity to:
Provide thought leadership and mentorship to CFW’s MIS reporting team on SAS and SSIS modelling, analytics and reporting functionality
Develop and manage key stakeholder relationships across ANZ business units including ANZ Technology, ANZ Retail Risk and other ANZ CFW Hubs
Be the CFW key contact for the wider ANZ MIS community for main bank programs of work
Providing accurate and timely reporting to support Customer Financial Wellbeing and ensure business unit financial objectives are met
Work with Customer Financial Wellbeing leaders and stakeholders to develop and implement solutions, changes and best practise within the target time period
Be responsible for the analysis, production and distribution of timely and accurate MIS, performance and portfolio information to support business.
Drive on-going improvement in Business Intelligence capability in line with best practice.
Oversight of existing Business Intelligence processes and apply maintenance as required
Contribute to CFW’s technology roadmap
Lead and provide oversight to the prioritisation of MIS work
Develop and maintain timely, accurate and insightful analytics and help develop early warning indicators
Role Location: Wellington
Role Type: Permanent, Full Time
Working Hours: Standard Business hours with plenty of flexibility available


About You:
This is a highly rewarding position that will draw heavily on your SAS and SSIS knowledge as much as your ability to communicate with and manage key stakeholders within both CFW and the wider bank. As well as well hones technical skills, you will need to be a natural people-person that can provide people leadership and ensuring that the MIS team are focused on providing customer centric solutions inline with CFW’s strategy and goals. To grow and be successful in this role, you will bring the following:
Solid technical capability in SAS and SSIS based Business Intelligence solutions and enterprise level data warehousing platforms (i.e MS SQL/ Oracle/ Teradata)
A customer focused mindset (both internal and external) that influences solutions developed by the team
Team leadership experience in providing technical mentoring and support as well as aligning work programmes to strategic goals and objectives
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills
Ideally a good understanding of Banking operations or from an industry or organisation with highly customer centric operations and values
Strongly developed interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate with, both written and verbal, and influence stakeholders across CFW, Retail Risk and Technology
Strong Analytical and statistical skills
Proven experience in developing macros, test planning and script development
Strength in one or more contemporary development languages would be an additional bonus
Please Note: Applications close on 19/02/2020. All applicants must have the unrestricted legal right to work in New Zealand at time of application.
Unfortunately no sponsorship requests can be considered.
